loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Da makes a living cultivating rice and selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en: Yeng’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yeng makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino is the head of a 4-member family who usually works as a fruit farmer but also as a driver the weekend. The latter makes him use frequently the mobile phone which he had to charge with his car, for instance. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house allows him to easily charge his mobile phone, as well as to have electrical lighting that his family uses to make their daily tasks. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this worker pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUORO-VILLAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NAMARO débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JIGUISSEME 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the JIGUISSEME 1 group are married women, who are on average 41 years old and have on average 4 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in KOUORO-VILLAGE, a village in the KOUORO commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to build up their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are peanuts with Mrs. NAMARO, standing on the far right in the photo in this women’s group JIGUISSEME 1. With this loan, she plans to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one container of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 61,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark, age 34, lives with his wife and 11-month-old son in Lusaka, the capital of Zambia. He is applying for his very first Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which he will run his own mobile money-transfer business.

A full-time police officer, Mark was attracted to Zoona as a way of earning extra income to sufficiently provide for his family. Mark will also employ one teller to help in his day-to-day operations. Once Mark is able to purchase his trading booth, his business will provide key financial services to his community members, allowing them to safely transfer remittances to friends and family. 

Diligent and friendly, Mark shows great promise as a Zoona agent. Mark would like to thank the Kiva lenders for helping make his dream of running his own business a reality.

loans.use: To purchase a big Zoona-branded trading booth which he will use to serve customers

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence, age 25, has just completed training to start his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business. He is seeking a Kiva loan to kick-start his business operations in Mazabuka, a town in the south of Zambia. 

Lawrence describes himself as someone who enjoys interacting with people and learning from others, traits that will be sure to help him thrive as a Zoona agent. He is excited to become a Zoona agent, as this will help him improve his family’s standard of living—an important role in a family of seven.

Lawrence will use his Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which he will serve customers. The booth will cost him approximately $820 USD. He will also use the money to purchase a mobile phone, a key piece of equipment in running a successful mobile money business.

After high school, Lawrence completed public administration coursework at the University of Zambia. With his Kiva loan, Lawrence hopes he can carry out his contribution to society by employing other Zambian youth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which he will serve customers

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen, age 31, runs his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in the fishing and farming town of Senanga, Zambia. He is newly married with a one-year-old baby. 

With his first Kiva loan, Owen was able to increase his mobile money float, thereby serving even more customers. He saw his profits grow and was thrilled to be able to pay for his own wedding ceremony! He successfully repaid his first loan of over $4,000 USD.

Owen is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to expand his successful business in Mulobezi, a small town in need of money-transfer services. Owen has carefully chosen the location based on the town’s needs, and he is excited to apply his business skills there. 

Owen thanks his Kiva lenders for the financial assistance that has changed his life for the better. On top of supporting his new family, he is still supporting his four siblings. Owen looks forward to expanding his business to improve the quality of life for his family and community.

loans.use: To serve customers who need to access financial services at his new location in Mulobezi

loans.name: Bero Group

texts.en:
Hanaa is the featured borrower of Bero group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they are best friends and trust each other. All of them seek a better living, which they are working hard to have.

Hanaa is a 22-year-old single lady who has worked as a tutor for two years to cover her living expenses. She is a hard worker, well known in her region because of her good reputation and the trust she has gained. Hanaa is acquiring a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for her expected wedding expenses. She is very anxious about this loan, because her and her fiancé's combined incomes aren't enough to cover these needs.

Hanaa is the lady standing in the middle, while Bernadet is the lady at the far right side of the picture, and Nadine is on the left.

loans.use: To pay for her expected wedding expenses

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Con el ánimo de seguir estudiando e independizarse de sus padres Jorge quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa; jeans, camisetas, blusas que inicialmente venderá a sus compañeros de trabajo. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá seguir estudiando y tener un ingreso extra para iniciar su vida independiente sin estar apegado a sus padres. 
A sus 30 años de edad quiere encontrar su pareja y formalizar una familia
texts.en:
With the goal of continuing to study and becoming independent from his parents, Jorge is requesting a loan to start a business selling clothing: jeans, t-shirts, and blouses. He will start off selling to his work friends.
With this loan, he will be able to continue studying and have an extra income to start his independent life without his parents' help. 30 years old, he wants to meet someone and start a family.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as jeans, shirts, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly steel, for making his pieces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for his home (adobe) to continue building.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad vive con su esposo, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce desde hace cinco años su negocio lo tiene cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, por esa razón tiene clientela ya establecida, con lo que vende y con la ayuda del esposo logran solventar  las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce por mayor y seguir con sus ventas, para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad  de vida
texts.en: María is 36 years old and lives with her husband. She is a very responsible and hard-working person, and has been making a living selling sweet bread for five years. María has her business near her home, in an area with a lot of passers-by. As a result she has many regular customers. With sales and help from her husband, María is able to cover household costs. María is applying for this loan in order to buy sweet bread in bulk and to continue with her sales. That way, she can enjoy a higher quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread in bulk.

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es: Cruz tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de un año de edad. Cruz se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de ropa como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, vestidos, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años y es así como  logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Cruz desea construir un servicio sanitario para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro, lámina, etc.
texts.en: Cruz is 27 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her spouse and her one-year-old daughter.  Cruz earns a living selling clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, etc.  She makes her sales on foot and has done so for six year.  This is how she is able to provide for her household.  Cruz wishes to build a bathroom, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, sheet metal, etc.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, sheet metal, etc... to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria  de 41 años de edad  es una persona responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, tiene un negocio de comedor y pupuseria cerca de u casa en un lugar muy transitado, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, quesillo, arroz, pollo, carne, verduras, frutas,  etc. y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, 41, is a reponsible, hard-working person who lives in her own home with her two children.  She runs a diner and "pupusa" (stuffed tortilla) business near her home which is in a very busy district.  With her income from sales she is able to cover household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, cheese, rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc. to give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, cheese, rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis mayor de edad casado con un hijo mayor de edad, originario de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario y administrador de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pulperia donde oferta productos de consumo diario como: granos básicos, abarroteria, golosinas, gaseosas, medicamentos populares, mercadería en general como: ropa, ropa interior, zapatos, cosméticos, cuadernos, productos plásticos, entre otros al igual vende gas licuado, sus compras son al contado en mercado, distribuidora y distribuidores de esta localidad sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio al publico, a parte de eso imparte clases de medio tiempo, buscando un medio de como mejorar sus ingresos, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio, tiene mayor demanda de clientes,se considera  una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora lo cual le a ayudado a sacar a delante a su familia, el crecimiento y mejora en su negocio le permitirá mejorar aun mas su nivel de vida, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo para el hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas, medicamentos, mercadería en general entre otros mas y de esa manera cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes y pedidos que tiene. Luis agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis is older, married, and has a grown child. He is from Chinandega, located in the east of the country. He is a hard-working and responsible man who wants to get ahead personally. He is a small businessperson and runs his own business, a grocery store, where he offers basic staples like: grains, grocery items, candy, pop, popular medicines, and general merchandise such as: clothing, underwear, shoes, cosmetics, notebooks, and plastic items. He also sells petroleum.
He makes his purchases in cash in the market and from distributors. He makes his sales in cash and has regular as well as occasional customers. He starts his day very early, opening his doors to the public. He also gives classes part time as a way to improve his income. One of his dreams is to be able to expand his business more. He has a greater demand from his clients. He is a very hard-working person, and he thinks that this has helped him to get his family ahead. The growth and improvement of his business will allow him to improve his standard of living even more. 
His goal for this loan is to invest in the purchase of basic products such as: grains, frozen goods, candy, medicines, and general merchandise. This will allow him to cover his customers' demand and to fill the orders that he has. Luis is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to invest in basic staples like: grains, frozen goods, candy, and petroleum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood to make some furniture.

loans.name: Beta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres jóvenes emprendedoras, que desde hace aproximadamente un mes se unieron para poder acceder a financiamiento, para comprar inventario para sus negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.  

Vernicia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Beta, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 27 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 10 años cursa su tercer grado de primaria. Su esposo es buzo. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace un año vende productos de bellezas y cosméticos por catálogo, también vende de manera ambulante mariscos.  Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: perfumes, cremas corporales, refrescantes, pinturas, maquillajes, entre otros productos.  Su sueño es tener su propio centro de acopio de mariscos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 4 young, enterprising women who got together about one month ago to gain access to financing in order to buy inventory for their businesses, improve their income and quality of life.   

Vernicia is the coordinator of the solidarity group, Beta. She is a native of Puerto Cabezas, is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. The eldest is 10 years old and is in third grade in elementary school. Her husband is a scuba diver. 

With the goal of having her own source of income, about a year ago she began to sell beauty products and cosmetics by catalog. She also sells shellfish door to door. She is requesting her first loan to buy perfumes, body lotions, splashes, eye shadow, make up and other products in Managua. Her dream is to have her own shellfish supply center.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, body lotions, splashes, eye shadows, makeup and other products in Managua.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizer and certified seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making heels and shoes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years old. He is married and has an 18-month-old baby girl. He lives in a rented house with his wife, their daughter and two of his cousins. He and his family are relocating 300 miles from his hometown of Mongu to the mining town of Kalumbila to start operating his own Zoona mobile money transfers business.

Currently, James works as a teller at a Zoona mobile money outlet in Mongu, Zambia. He has been working as a teller for three years. Understanding the mobile money business well, James would like to open his own outlet so that he can earn more income and provide better for his family. He is a big believer in the mobile money industry and the service it provides his community. Many people are in need of accessible and easy ways to transfer money in Zambia, he says.

The loan will help James purchase a small trading booth and internet capable mobile phone which he will use to serve customers. The remaining money will be used to provide James with cash-on-hand to serve his customers' money transfer needs.

James thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in giving him the opportunity to start his business after many years of dreaming this day would come.

loans.use: to purchase a small trading booth and an internet enabled phone device which he will use to serve customers

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José es un hombre aguerrido, creativo, humilde y muy emprendedor, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la confección y venta de hamacas artesanales que vende en los municipios del bajo cauca Colombiano.
Estos productos los vende de manera ambulante y la actividad la aprendió de manera empírica.
Desde hace un año inicio con la confección de bolsos y morrales buscando otras alternativas de ingresos y complementar su trabajo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de trabajo como telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros; elementos que le permitirán mantener su nivel de trabajo y continuar con su labor.
Con este trabajo ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que es cabeza de hogar y debe responder por todos los gastos de su hogar.
Es un hombre responsable y muy amoroso con sus hijos, siempre procurando ofrecerles lo mejor.
Esta es una actividad muy típica de la región colombiana y José es considerado casi como un artesano.
texts.en:
Jose is a courageous, creative, modest and very enterprising man. For 10 years he has been producing and selling handcrafted hammocks. He sells them in the towns of the Bajo Cauca region of Colombia.

He sells the products as a street vendor and he learned how to make and sell them through experience.

A year ago he started making bags and backpacks as an alternative source of income and to complement his work. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase work supplies, such as material, thread and needles, among other items; these are things that enable him to maintain his level of production and to continue working.

With this business he has been able to help his children get ahead since he is head of the household and needs to take responsibility for all household expenses.

He is a responsible man who is very loving with his children and who always tries to provide them with the best.

This is a business that is quite typical in the Colombian region and Jose is considered to be almost a craftsman.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make bags and backpacks.

loans.name: Pierluigi

texts.es:
Pierluigi es un joven emprendedor, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es un joven muy inteligente y con muchos deseos de superación. Estudia la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Ambiental y Sanitaria porque quiere contribuir con el desarrollo sostenible.
También trabaja como Asistente Administrativo en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable, honesto y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. A su corta edad tiene varios proyectos en mente que quiere ejercerlo más adelante y siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia.
Pierluigi está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su casa como colocar un portón para mayor seguridad y pintarrajear las paredes. De esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder formar su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Pierluigi is a young entrepreneur. He is 18 years old, single and lives with his family. He is a very intelligent youth who is eager to succeed. He studied environmental health engineering because he wants to contribute to sustainable development.

He also works as an administrative assistant in a prestigious company and it is going very well for him because he is hardworking, responsible, honest and eager to get ahead. At his young age, he has several projects in mind that he wants to implement in the future and he is always attentive to the wellbeing of his family.

Pierluigi is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to refurbish his house by installing a main door for greater security and painting the walls. Thus he will improve the quality of life for his family and continue striving so that later he will be able to open his own business.

loans.use: to upgrade his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase toys that will improve her child daycare service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, and silver and steel accessories to start her business and build her future

loans.name: Magnolia Del Socorro

texts.es: Magnolia es una experimentada y muy inteligente mujer de ya una avanzada edad que a partir de su liquidación por servicios de confección, decidió adecuar su hogar y comprar una maquinaria para seguir con la labor que le ha dado de comer a ella y a su hijo por tantos anos, gracias a sus habilidades tanto en la maquina como empresariales ha logrado generarle empleo a sus familia, tal es el ejemplo de su sobrina (Ver Foto)logrando así una muy fuerte empresa familiar. Como mujer de negocios Magnolia se le presenta diferentes tipos de negocio y su éxito radica en la habilidad que tiene para sacarle el máximo provecho a estos negocio y hoy en día s ele presenta una buena oportunidad laboral un contrato que le puede garantizar trabajo a ella y su familia por un buen tiempo pero el primer paso es tener éxito en la primera entrega y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para estar dispuestos a trabajar el día que le entreguen la mercancía y cubrir cualquier improvisto, también mejora sus máquinas realizándoles manteamiento pues con el éxito de este negocio las usara por un buen tiempo.
texts.en: Magnolia is an experienced and very intelligent older woman who decided to buy a sewing machine for her home to continue her manufacturing work that has fed her and her son. Thanks to her skills, she has created a strong family business. The photo shows her niece working with her.  Magnolia has different types of business skills and her success lies in her ability to make the most of these skills. Today, she has a good opportunity to guarantee a job for her and her family but she needs to first invest in the purchase of inputs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to improve and maintain her sewing machines and to protect her against any unforeseen accidents that happen while working.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain her sewing machines and to to cover any unforeseen accidents that happen when working

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un profesional de la ciudad de Pilar, ya tiene una carrera terminada, pero sigue estudiando para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Está estudiando para ser docente universitaria, y comenta que quiere capacitarse adecuadamente de modo a probar oportunidades de crecimiento profesional y laboral, su fortaleza es su familia y tratar de que no les falte nada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
John is a professional from Pilar city. He has already completed his degree, but is still studying in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

He is studying to be a university professor, and says he wants to be trained properly in order to take advantage of opportunities for professional growth and advancement. His strength comes from his family and he tries to make sure they want for nothing.

He is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay his tuition fees, to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, es profesora se dedica a enseñar sus conocimientos a las diferentes generaciones, vocación que aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos eran profesores.

Su hija se dedica a estudiar para un día llegar a dedicarse a la misma profesión que María.

María se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. ya que para llegar al lugar donde enseña es en una isla, pero la distancia no es impedimento para enseñar sus conocimientos a sus alumnos posee mas de 40 años en esta profesión. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar zicalum, polines,cemento,etc ya que su techo no sirve y se filtra el agua en invierno lo que le daña sus electrodomésticos y su mobiliario.

 María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo y del préstamo  mejorar su vivienda y en un futuro comprar un vehículo para  transportarse.
texts.en:
Maria, 63 years old, is a teacher devoted to sharing her knowledge with different generations, a vocation she learned from her parents who were teachers.

Her daughter is studying in order to one day devote herself to the same profession as Maria.

Maria gets up at 4:30 AM in order to reach the place where she teaches, which is on an island.  However, distance is no impediment to her sharing her knowledge with her students.  She has worked in this profession for more than 40 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy metal sheets, planks, cement, etc., since her roof has gone bad and water leaking in during the winter will damage her appliances and furniture.  

With her income from work and with the loan, Maria plans to improve her home and in future to buy a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, planks, cement, etc., since her roof has gone bad and leaks water in winter which damages her appliances and furniture

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 41 años de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, su familia está formada por dos hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias.

Arturo se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ordeñar y luego irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Que necesita para la siembra,  cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha.

Él planea en un futuro tener más ganado de ordeño en un corral donde tenerlos,  ya que actualmente alquila con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de su familia y de las ganancias obtenidas darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Arturo, 41 years old, earns a living by farming and raising cattle.  He grew up with his parents who taught him these types of work.  His family consists of his two children and his wife, who all help him in the daily work. 

Arthur gets up at 4:30 AM to milk the cows and then goes to the fields where he works through the morning with his children.  His wife takes care of the housework and caring for their cows.

He is asking for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy poison, seeds, fertilizers, etc., needed for planting.  The necessary experience gained in many years will help him get a good harvest.

In the future, Arthur plans to have more milk cattle in their own corral, whereas now he is renting a place for the cows with the help of another loan.  With the assistance of his family and from the profits he plans to provide them a better future.

loans.use: to buy poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc., needed for planting

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, 37, operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in the mining town of Solwezi. He began operating his business as a way of providing for his daughter and fiancé. 

Martin’s first Kiva loan helped him jump start his business. He was able to purchase mobile phones, key equipment he uses daily in mobile money transactions and, to boost his float, the amount of mobile money he uses to serve customers. As a result, Martin has seen his profits begin to grow. 

Martin is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to scale his business. He plans to use the loan to boost his float amounts, allowing him to grow his Zoona customer base and to run his business operations more seamlessly. 

Martin enjoys interacting with customers from all different walks of life and he values the opportunity he has to serve his community. He hopes this Kiva loan will allow him to grow his first outlet and he has plans to expand into more outlets. Martin hopes his business will succeed, so he will be able to provide better opportunities for his family. With a second Kiva loan, he knows that soon he will no longer struggle to take care of his family.

Martin thanks all the lenders for their continued support and for the positive impact their loans have made on his business and daily life.

loans.use: to grow his business by adding more money to serve customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 28-year-old man, married to Elizabeth, who adds an additional income to support their family. They have been blessed with two children. 

Stephen has been operating a capsicum (peppers) and vegetable business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Stephen is servicing his third loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use this amount to add more stocks of capsicum and vegetables to sell to his customers.

Stephen plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and to purchase his own land to build a permanent house for his family. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy capsicum and vegetables stocks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana una joven de 23 años de edad que desde los 12 años esta en el mundo comercial trabajando como vendedora de ropa hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de ser independizarse y montar su propio negocio.
Trabaja todos los días con la ilusión y el ánimo de cada día ser mejor empresaria y aspirar a tener su propio local comercial por estar razón quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y surtido con lo que lograra tener mejor exposición de sus productos. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito tendrá su local más organizado y atraerá mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Ana is a 23 year old young woman, who has been in the commercial world since she was 12 years old working as a clothing seller, until she had the opportunity to become independent and start her own business.

She works every day with the hope and courage to become a better business woman. She aspires to have her own commercial space. Toward this end she wants to continue investing in her business and is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of a display case  and inventory so that she can better display her products

With help from this loan she will have a more organized venue and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and inventory, particularly clothing for boys and girls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her clothing sales business

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha, con el afán de ofrecerles lo mejor a sus hijos y de darles un ejemplo de vida, decidió iniciar con un negocio de venta de ropa y mercancía variada desde hace tres años.
Ha podido recoger muy buenas experiencias a pesar de ser empírica en este oficio.
Su hermana fue quien la motivo a iniciar este negocio y es ella quien le consigue el surtido en Medellín y se lo envía hasta Sonsón.
Sus principales clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar surtido de tennis en diferentes marcas, así podrá ampliar su gama de productos y atraerá más clientes.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, con muchos sueños y disposición para cumplirlos.
texts.en:
Martha, with the desire to offer the best to her children and give them a good life, started her own business three years ago where she sells clothing and various merchandise. She has been able to have many great experiences with this business.

Her sister was the person who motivated her to start this business and it is her sister who gets the assortment of clothing in Medellin and sends it to Sonson. 

Her principal clients are her friends, neighbors, and family. 

She is asking for a loan in order provide more capital for her business to purchase different brands clothing to increase her selection of goods to attract more clients. She is very entrepreneurial and a hard worker, with many dreams and willingness to achieve them.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jackets to sell

loans.name: Al Ataa 1 50456 Group

texts.en:
Layla is the featured borrower of Al Ataa 1 50456 Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard together to provide their families with their necessary living needs.

Layla is a 42-year-old married mother of three, for whom she works hard with her husband to provide them with the best living and education. She has run a mobile phone selling shop for six years and her business is going on just fine. Just like any small business, Layla needs an additional external push to develop it, especially because she has fixed responsibilities towards her family that she can't deny or neglect. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua--to increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards that will increase her sales and develop her business properly.

Layla is the first from the left, while Mirna is the lady at the center of the picture and Sariya is the lady at the far right side of the picture with the grey top.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as snack foods and beverages, to restock in her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of snack foods and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven de 19 años con gran energía y deseos de salir adelante para ser exitosa y sobresalir exitosamente en su vida.
Ella es muy trabajadora y desde hace 6 meses inicio con un negocio de venta de mercancía como joyería y elementos de bisutería, además de relojes y llaveros.
Inicio la actividad con el fin de obtener unos mejores ingresos y así colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.
Es una joven muy trabajadora a pesar de su corta edad ya que trabaja alternativamente en un hotel realizando remplazos por días.
Todos sus sueños están enfocados en el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y poder sostener sus estudios superiores.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía y de este modo mejorar su inventario en volumen y variedad.
Entre esta mercancía cabe destacar bisutería y relojes.
texts.en: Veronica is a young 19 year old girl with a lot of energy and hopes of moving forward to be successful and excel in life.  She is very hardworking and six months ago, she started a business of selling merchandise such as jewelry and costume jewelry, in addition to watches and keychains.  She started the activity with the goal of earning better income and therefore being able to help with the expenses of her home.  She is a very hardworking young girl despite her age and works alternately in a hotel as a replacement on certain days.  All her dreams are focused on the improvement of her quality of life and being able to sustain her higher education.  She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise and as a result, improve her inventory in volume and variety.  Among this merchandise are jewelry and watches.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as costume jewelry and watches.

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
Gloria es la orgullosa dueña de dos vacas lecheras, pues para ella sus dos criaturas son hermosas y las quiere como a un hijo no solo porque creció con ellas si no por que estas se convirtieron en la principal fuente de ingresos para ella. 
En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de sus hijos quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vaca con la que quiere ampliar su producción diaria de leche. 
Su gran sueño es tener una granja y rodearse de animales pues de verdad los ama con el corazón.
texts.en: Gloria is the proud owner of two dairy cows, and for her, her two animals are beautiful.  She loves them like a child, not only because she grew up with them, but also because have turned into her main source of income.  In search of improving the quality of life for both her and her children, she is requesting a loan to purchase a cow so that she can expand her daily production of milk.  Her big dream is to have a ranch and be surrounded by animals because she truly loves them with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to improve her production of milk.

loans.name: Marta Monica

texts.es:
Marta ha sufrido el duro verdugo del desplazamiento forzado a causa de la violencia. Ella se vio obligada a desplazarse junto con su familia a Medellín en busca de nuevas oportunidades de vida.
Al principio todo fue muy duro ya que le toca aguantar hambre y frio, sobreviviendo solo de la caridad y el buen corazón de las personas.
Hoy en día vive en el barrio Santo Domingo, Medellín, que es un barrio marginado y con deficiencias en la prestación de los servicios básicos como agua, luz, servicios de salud y seguridad.
Logro montar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con mucho esfuerzo y así han podido sobrevivir en esta parte de la ciudad.
Sus ventas no son muy buenas a causa de la economía de este sector.
Ella pide un crédito para la compra de surtido en productos de la canasta familiar y de esta forma poder aumentar su inventario.
Actualmente solo confía en el buen corazón de las personas que puedan ayudarle con su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta suffered from displacement due to violence. She was forced to leave with her family and go to Medellin in search of new opportunities. 

In the beginning, everything was very hard and she was cold and hungry, surviving only from the charity and good hearts of other people. Now she lives in the neighborhood of Santo Domingo, Medellin, which is a marginalized neighborhood that lacks basic services like water, electricity, health services, and security. She strongly maintains a small grocery store and has been able to survive in this part of the city, although her sales are not very good because of this sector's economy.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of products in order to increase her inventory. She currently only trusts the people who have good hearts and help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods for her store

loans.name: Willbroad

texts.en:
Willbroad, age 42, is an agriculture dealer who also operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in his hometown of Mansa, Zambia. Willbroad is married with three children aged 13,10, and 7, all of whom are attending primary school.

Willbroad, a seasoned Zoona agent, has been operating his Zoona business for five years. Over the years, he says, Mansa residents have benefited greatly because of his business’ easy access, user-friendliness, and affordable rates. He enjoys running his own mobile money business because it gives him the opportunity to network with other small business owners and to provide for his family’s basic needs.

Willbroad is requesting his first Kiva loan to increase his float, the amount of mobile money he has available to serve customers. With more float, Willbroad will be able to increase his profits, to better his family’s living standards, and to grow his business.

loans.use: to add on to his working capital so that he can serve customers who need to send and receive money.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 44 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge tiene un hijo en su poder de 9 años de edad, viven en el Caserío Vista Alegre, en su propia vivienda de material rústico, en una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y engorde de ganado vacuno en una inverna cercana a su vivienda, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera lo que le permita generar ingresos adicionales con la venta de leche fresca y queso fresco que su esposa prepara artesanalmente.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is 44 years old. He has a stable home with his wife. They have a 9 year old son. They live in the village of Vista Alegre, in their own home of rustic material, in the rural area of the District of Santo Tomas, located in the Province of Cutervo, part of the Region of Cajamarca in the Northern Andes of Peru.

Their population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock. He works raising and fattening bovine animals in an enclosed corral close to his house. His wife helps him in this job. He is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to Edpyme Alternativa to buy a milking cow that will allow him to receive more revenue with the sale of fresh milk and cheese that his wife prepares.

loans.use: to purchase a cow that will allow him to generate better income through the sale of milk

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 35 years old, married, and his family lives in Padul. Dexter obtains income through rice farming. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. 

As a farmer, he uses his net income from the previous harvest for the next planting season. Dexter only gained minimal income from his previous harvest, and that is why he is now asking for additional capital of 50,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy insect killer, herbicides, and fertilizers used in farming. This will help fight pests that will destroy and affect his crop's growth. 

Someday, Dexter hopes to achieve a fruitful harvest so he will pay back his loan from the organization on time. He hopes to save funds for his family’s emergency purposes too.

loans.use: to buy insect killer, herbicides, and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is a 63-year-old, married woman, living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. 

She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for ten years. 

Nhan would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store, such as snack foods and confectionaries. 

She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store, such as snack foods and confectionaries.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is requesting a new loan to raise the floor of her house to keep goods away from floodwaters, and to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock in her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to raise the floor of her house to keep goods away from floodwaters, and to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock in her general store.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is a 47-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two children. He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 30 years. 

Phi would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock in his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock in his general store.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men is a 60-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. Men would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectioneries, to stock in her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectioneries, to stock in her general store.

loans.name: Riham 50083 Group

texts.en:
Luzane is the featured borrower of Riham 50083 Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard together to provide their families with their necessary living needs. 

Luzane is a 29-year-old married mother of one, for whom she works hard with her husband to provide them with the best living and education. 
She has run a special curtain tailoring and selling shop for a year and a half, and her business is going on just fine. 

Just like any small business, Luzane needs an additional external push to develop it, especially because her business is still new, and she has fixed responsibilities towards her family that she can't deny or neglect. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua--to buy newly released textile designs that will develop her business and attract new customers. 

Luzane is the first from the right, while Wadad is the lady in the center of the picture, and Ghinwa is the lady on the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: to buy newly released textile designs that will develop her business and attract new customers.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is a married man and a farmer raising crops, particularly planting and harvesting rice to sell. In addition to his income in the farming business, his wife also raises hogs and sells them upon maturity. They work together for their family’s benefits. 

Now, Rodolfo is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides used in farming. Someday, Rodolfo hopes to achieve a fruitful harvest and keep investing in their businesses for the improvement of their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Mwanida

texts.en:
Mwanida, 29, is a Zambian mobile money entrepreneur and the single mother of a four-year-old son. Last year, Mwanida received a Kiva loan that enabled her to increase her float—the amount of mobile money she has available in her business at any given time—to serve even more Zoona customers. As a result, Mwanida has seen her profits increase and has even been able to hire a teller.

Mwanida is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to scale her business. She plans to purchase her trading booth outright, allowing her to own her portable storefront and to eliminate her rental payments. She also plans to purchase a new phone, allowing her to make transactions more quickly, and to boost her float to serve her growing customer base.

Mwanida enjoys her business because she is able to offer financial services to her community and to employ young Zambians who have just graduated from high school. Mwanida’s business empowers her to provide for her family’s needs, such as paying for her son’s pre-school fees. In turn, Mwanida’s business empowers her own employees—her teller is now saving money for college tuition.

Mwanida is very grateful for the support she has received from Kiva in starting her Zoona money transfer business. She looks forward to the opportunity to grow her business even further with a subsequent Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth which she will use to serve her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Phadis

texts.en:
Phadis is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for her kids.

Phadis has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu has operated a real estate business which has helped her to boost the living standards of her life. In addition, she sells household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

She comes to you for another loan of 50,000 KES  to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Popo

texts.en:
Popo is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Popo dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase and stock wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase and stock wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang is 36 years old and lives with her two children and husband, who works as a mason. For the past three years, Trang has been running a food stall from the front of her house to earn income to support her family. 

Trang is the Group Leader of a nine-member loan group living in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is sitting second from the left, wearing a white jacket. Each of the group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Trang is requesting a loan to purchase better quality foods and ingredients to make meals to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will help her to better meet the tastes of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality foods and ingredients to make meals to sell from her stall

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es:
Henrry, trabaja como empleado en una empresa  privada de la ciudad de La Paz. También tiene un taxi del cual recibe ingresos diarios para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para  reparación de vehiculo, compra de llantas, batería y otros el cual es su herramienta de trabajo.
El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Henrry works as an employee for a private company in the city of La Paz. He also has a taxi from which he receives a daily income for sustaining his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used for vehicle repairs and to buy tires, a battery, and other parts since this vehicle is his work tool. Henrry is single, has no children, and lives in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and to buy tires, a battery, and other parts.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva, a 39-year-old single lady, has been working in the beauty business for 12 years to cover her family's living expenses; she is responsible for supporting three family members.

Silva is a talented beauty expert who works hard to keep on developing her business in order to meet both her customers' needs and her family's living requirements. She is now requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a tattoo machine to  further develop her business.

Silva hopes to keep on developing her enterprise and meeting her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To buy a tattoo machine that will develop her business through the diversified services she provides to her customers

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman; she has seven children, all of whom attend school. Kabibi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kabibi operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the 25,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings), she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Sophia owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Sophia has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a farmer and he is 37 years old. In his farming business, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He also hires laborers who help him in farming activities, like plowing, sowing, and transplanting rice seedlings. 

Noel is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming. He will also pay laborers in the rice field. This loan will help improve rice production. 

Someday, with good growth and development of the business, he will gain more income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
En un barrio deprimido por la pobreza y aquejada por la violencia nacen grandes héroes que con sus trabajos humildes y honrados contribuyen al mejoramiento de su sector y que futuras generaciones disfruten de un mejor ambiente.
Uno de estos héroes es Jesús un joven de 20 años de edad  el cual decidió decirle no a las armas y a los grupos y comenzar su venta de productos como frituras, golosinas y chocolates, ha ido surtiendo su negocio a poco a poco pero pro la falta de capital no ha podido consolidar de mejor manera su negocio.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar como verduras, abarrotes y granos con los que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su pareja para pensar en que si es posible un mejor futuro
texts.en:
In a neighborhood which is depressed by poverty and troubled by violence, big heroes are born, who contribute, through their humble and honest work, to the improvement of their area, so that future generations may enjoy a better environment.

One of these heroes is Jesus, a young man of 20 years of age, who decided to say no to the arms and the gangs, and to start his sales of products such as fried snacks, candy and chocolate. He has been stocking his business gradually, but due to the lack of capital, he has not been able to better consolidate his business.

He requests a loan for the purchase of basic food basket products, such as vegetables, groceries and grains, with which he hopes to improve the living conditions for himself and his partner, to think that a better future is possible.

loans.use: to buy basic food basket products, such as vegetables, grains, and groceries, for example rice, sugarcane, beans, coriander, bananas, and other items.

loans.name: Catherine Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Catherine Carmen se sigue dedicando al negocio de profesora de musica,la socia tiene un taller de musica,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su taller de musica.La socia solicita el credito para comprar guitarra,flauta y violin.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Catherine Carmen continues in her profession as a music teacher. She has a music studio where she works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Catherine has been in her business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her music studio.

Catherine is requesting a loan in order to buy a guitar, a flute, and a violin. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a guitar, a flute, and a violin.

loans.name: German Dario

texts.es:
Germán es un humilde y trabajador campesino que cansado de el trabajo del campo decidió dedicarse al área de la construcción desde hace algunos años. Luego de haber experimentado este trabajo como ayudante y darse cuenta de lo duro y mal remunerado que era este trabajo, decidió iniciar con su propio negocio de ferretería y deposito en el municipio de Medellín.
Tiene un poco de elementos para iniciar con su actividad pero le hace falta aumentar su inventario con elementos como tubería, cemento, adobes, herramientas, entre otros.
Con el apoyo del crédito él podrá abrir su negocio al público y comenzar con este proyecto al cual promete sacarlo adelante con mucha responsabilidad y pasión.
Teniendo en cuenta sus raíces campesinas, es muy probable que consiga tener un negocio muy reconocido ya que es un hombre trabajador y muy emprendedor.
texts.en:
Germán is a humble and hard-working man from the country.  Being tired of working in the fields, he decided to work in construction some years ago.  Then, after experiencing this work as a helper and realizing how hard this work was and how poorly it paid, he decided to start his own hardware business and store in the Medellin municipality. 

He has a few things to start his business activity, but he needs to increase his inventory with pipes, cement, bricks, tools and other items.

With the support of the loan he will be able to open his business to the public.  He will start this project, which promises to get him ahead very responsibly and passionately.

Keeping in mind his country roots, it is very likely that he will have a very well-known business because he is a hard-working man, and he is very enterprising.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his hardware business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José es un joven de 28 años de edad, que está casado, padre de un hijo de 3 años, su nivel de estudio fue hasta noveno grado,  pues él no contaba con el dinero suficiente y sus padres no tenían por eso no lo apoyaban económicamente, él lo que hacía era trabajar por la mañana y por la tarde ir a estudiar pero sentía que era bien difícil para él desarrollar dos actividades, es por este motivo que no logro seguir estudiando, y opto por casarse y formar su propia familia, en su vivienda solo viven y dependen de él solo su esposa y su hijo.

José tiene dos actividades que le generan ingresos a su familia, el primero él trabaja en una empresa eléctrica comenta que tiene ya 3 años de laborar en esa empresa, este trabajo lo adquirió gracias a la recomendación de un amigo logro entrar a trabajar en esa empresa, a una distancia de 5 kilómetros que los recorre en una motocicleta, su hora de entrada es de las 8 de la mañana a las 3 de la tarde. Él también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de hortalizas comenta que desde su   infancia realiza esta actividad pues es muy productiva junto a su esposa que le apoya en los trabajos y aparte de generarle ingresos económicos le proporciona alimentos para su familia.


El financiamiento del crédito lo utilizara específicamente en la agricultura, siembra de guisquil comprara un royo de alambre pues es parte de la estructura para que el cultivo se pueda desarrollar perfectamente también comprara un saco de abono para suministrarle a estos cultivos y pago de mano de obra y le genere mayores ganancias, pues él siempre quiso tener unos cultivos bien arreglados y cuidados.

José nunca pierde la esperanza de seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria junto a su esposa, también tener un mejor empleo, reparar un poco su vivienda, comprar un vehículo que le facilite el trabajo en los cultivos, también ampliar más sus cultivos  y mejorarlos para que puedan producir más todo esto comenta que lo lograra con las ganancias de las ventas y con futuros créditos que solicitara para desarrollar sus sueños.
texts.en:
José is a 28 year old who is married and a father of a three-year-old son.  He studied until ninth grade because he did not have enough money and neither did his parents so they could not support him financially.  He used to work in the mornings and in the afternoons he would go to school, but he found it very difficult to do both. For this reason, he was not able to continue attending school, and instead he decided to get married and start his own family.  In his home, only his wife and son live with him and depend on him.

José has two jobs that generate an income for his family.  His first job is with an electrical company where he has worked for three years.  He landed this job thanks to a friend who recommended him.  The company is 5 kilometers away and he gets there on his motorcycle.  He works there from 8am to 3pm.  He also works as a farmer, growing vegetables, which he has done since he was young.  It is a very productive activity for him and his wife who helps him with the work.  In addition to generating income for them, it also provides them with food.  

The loan that he is seeking will be used specifically for farming to grow pear squash.  He will purchase a roll of wire to build a structure for the crops to develop perfectly.  He will also purchase a sack of manure to apply to the crops, and pay for labor.  This will allow him to generate greater earnings because he always wanted to have crops that were well arranged and cared for. 

José never loses hope of being able to attend college with his wife.  He also dreams of having a better job, repairing his home, purchasing a vehicle that will facilitate his farming, increasing his crops and improving his crops so that they will yield greater harvests.  He says that he will achieve all of this with the earnings from his sales and with other loans that he will seek to reach his dreams.

loans.use: purchase a roll of wire, a sack of manure, and to pay for labor to grow pear squash.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos, y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 9 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio donde vende variedad de ropa como camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa de niño y short, las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el decimo ciclo de préstamo y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas mercadería como pantalones, camisas, blusas para aumentar su inventario y ventas. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y brindad una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 36 years old, single, and has two children. She resides in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

For the past nine years, Rosibel has dedicated herself to her business of selling a variety of clothes such as shirts, blouses, skirts, trousers, children’s clothing, and shorts. She conducts her sales from her home and as a traveling vendor. The loan she is requesting is her tenth one and is in the amount of 10,000 HNL. She will buy more merchandise such as trousers, shirts, and blouses so that she can increase her inventory and her sales. Her goals are to grow her business and to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUORO-VILLAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame WASSA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JIGUISSEME 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the JIGUISSEME 2 group are married women and they are, on average, 44 years old with four children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Kouoro-Village, a village located in the commune of Kouoro, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farming loan with the institution, and they have duly repaid their previous loans. 

Wassa, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village and in Sikasso. Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash or on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 61,000 CFA francs per planting season.  Wassa will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover plowing costs.

loans.name: William Alonso

texts.es:
El señor William es un agricultor que como muchos no tuvieron acceso al estudio y solo depende de sus cultivos para poder llevar una alimentación a sus hijos. 
Como persona humilde en muchas ocasiones no dispone de capital suficiente para preparar sus tierras para el cultivo y no el saca el mayor provecho a sus campos, por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes con los cuales quiere sacar mayor provecho a sus tierras aparte de ser insumos de gran importancia en una plantación. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá garantizar sus tierras y tener trabajo para sostener a su familia
texts.en: William is a farmer who like many did not have access to education.  He depends only on his farming to provide for his children.  As a humble person, on many occasions, he does not have enough money to prepare his land for farming and he is not able to make the most of his fields.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as seeds, manure, and fertilizers with which he wants to take advantage of his lands since they are very important farming supplies.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to prepare his land and have work to sustain his family.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as manure, fertilizers, seeds and fungicides.

loans.name: Campo Alirio

texts.es: Campo tiene 34 años de edad, él se dedica a la ganadería juntamente con sus hermanos, entre ellos  tienen su pequeño negocio, comenta campo que  son ya 25 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que antes era él y su familia quienes atendían su ganado y que en la actualidad son unas personas colombianas quienes trabajan cuidando y ordeñan las vacas, Campo se encuentra trabajando de chofer,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para seguir adelante con su negocio y también  para seguir dando trabajo a  sus cuidadores que son personas colombianas.
texts.en: Campo ia 34 years old. He raises cattle along with his siblings, between them they have a small business. He shares that they have been working raising cattle for 25 years, and previously it was he and his family who took care of the cattle. Today there are some Colombians who work taking care of and milking the cows. Campo works as a driver. The loan will be used to invest in buying a cow to continue growing his business and also to continue providing work to the Colombian caretakers.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase certified seeds and agricultural supplies to care for her crops once they are planted.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Victor es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Lima junto a su familia.
Tiene un pequeño hijo, lamentablemente no vive con la madre de su pequeño, pero eso no es impedimento para que se esfuerce día a día para poder ofrecerle todas las comodidades que se merece y velar por un futuro mejor.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración, Finanzas y Negocios y desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Auxiliar de Negocios en una prestigiosa empresa. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y porque siempre trabaja con mucho empeño y dedicación.
Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá iniciar sus trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida con algunos ingresos adicionales que obtenga como chofer. Con esto apoyará a su familia y seguirá luchando para poder culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Victor is a young entrepreneur.  He is 20 years old, single and lives in Lima with his family.  He has a young son, and he unfortunately does not live with the mother of his son.  However, this is not an impediment to him striving day after day to provide his son with all of the comforts he deserves, and ensure a better future for him.  Currently, he is studying for a professional career in administration, finance and business.  For over a year, he has worked as a business aide in a prestigious company. It has gone very well for him because he is very responsible, hardworking, honest, and because he always works with a lot of persistence and dedication.

Victor is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to begin the procedures to obtain his driver's license.  This will allow him to improve his quality of life by generate additional earnings as a chauffeur.  With this, he will support his family and continue fighting to finish his university studies.

loans.use: with proceedings to get his driver's license.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen is 52 years old, she lives with her partner and they have two sons. She has selling products for the last six years, Carmen says that a relative started her in the business, she enjoyed it and decide to keep doing it. Carmen has been selling through catalogs for the last six years and she has a portfolio of recurring clients, last  year she took a loan and payed on time, now Carmen is asking for a second loan to buy shoes, clothes to sell in the back to school season. She says that she has shown that she is credit worthy because she always pays her loans on time. Her goal is providing the best life for her sons.
texts.en: Carmen is 52 years old, she lives with her partner and they have two sons. She has selling products for the last six years, Carmen says that a relative started her in the business, she enjoyed it and decide to keep doing it. Carmen has been selling through catalogs for the last six years and she has a portfolio of recurring clients, last  year she took a loan and payed on time, now Carmen is asking for a second loan to buy shoes, clothes to sell in the back to school season. She says that she has shown that she is credit worthy because she always pays her loans on time. Her goal is providing the best life for her sons.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell in the back to school season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to stock her store.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Hace 5 años inicio la solución de Antonio cuando decidió convertirse en independiente con su negocio de reparación de electrodomésticos y es que su gran ambición desde que inició su negocio ha sido convertirse en el mejor en su profesión y duro 5 años para consolidarse y formalizarse como empresa y aspira que en otros 5 años llegar a ser el número 1 en su municipio.
Antonio trabaja diariamente para lograr sus metas y lo más importante ser un gran apoyo para su familia por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos en mal estado para repararlos y posteriormente venderlos sacándoles buen provecho económico a estos artículos que la gente creía que ya eran inútiles, con este apoyo podrá brindarle a las familias de bajos recursos electrodomésticos a precios asequibles
texts.en:
5 years ago Antonio decided to start his own business repairing small electrical appliances and it is his great ambition since starting his business that he is the best in his field. It took 5 years to prepare, launch and establish the business and he hopes within another 5 years he will be #1 in his area.

Antonio works daily to meet his goals and the most important is to be a great support for his family. Therefore he seeks a loan to buy small electrical appliances and electronics that do not work to repair them to then sell them at a lower price to families with few economic resources at accessible prices, thus taking what some deem as useless broken items and providing opportunity for others.

loans.use: to buy broken electronics to repair and resell.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a 43-year-old husband and a father to four children, ages 13, 8, 6, and 1. Three of of his children are in school. He lives in Lusaka, Zambia, where he serves in the police service. Jones has just completed training to start his own Zoona mobile money transfers business.

Jones is excited for the opportunity to run his own business. He says this will help him provide for his family, as his salary is not enough to support his family’s needs.
