He is the only source of income, because Runa is a housewife, though she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they want to grow their business by cultivating jute, which is a profitable crop and in much demand. Moreover, it is the best season to cultivate this crop.  They are eagerly waiting for financial help to redefine their family's future by building their livelihood.

Runa heard about Kiva's partner BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers.  With these, she can look forward to a full crop of jute.  Earlier she could not afford to buy with their low income.  She hopes that the increased income will strengthen their family's economy and help her to enroll her daughters in school.

She will be ever grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Sefali

texts.en:
Sefali is a young woman of only 31 years.  She is married and lives with her husband and their three school-going children (one son and two daughters). She is married to Manoronjon, age 42, who is uneducated and can only sign his name.  Sefali received a primary education. Their children are in different grades of primary and secondary levels. They live in the small village of Mauyamari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Sefali and her husband were deprived of an education because of the poor financial resources of their family.  So they are very much concerned about their children's education and try heart and soul to provide the expenses.

Sefali’s husband owns a cycle-van (used in rural areas for carrying goods and people).  He earns money by driving the cycle-van.  He is the only earning member of the family.  But the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses.  So they thought of purchasing a new van so that they rent the old one for hire for carrying goods and people for additional income.

Sefali has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van for her husband who is a young, enthusiastic and energetic person with a great desire to provide his family members with a normal standard of life.  She hopes this will give her financial stability.

She and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonor ella es soltera y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, trigo y quinua.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo esperemos que para la próxima reunión estén todos reunidos.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Banco del Desarrollo" communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

One of the members is Leonor who is 33 years old and has a son.  She works selling cereals such as corn, wheat and quinoa, with a daily schedule of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She has been in business for four years and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to have her own locale where she can sell her goods.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wheat and quinoa.

The individual photos are of members who were unable to be present for the group photo for work-related reasons.  We hope the entire group will be present at the next meeting.

The other members have businesses such as a laundry service, Internet service, a grocery store and a restaurant.

Leonor is grateful to those participating in her dream and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy corn, wheat and quinoa.

loans.name: Krinjimalar Shg - Melavaladi Group

texts.en:
Rajalakshmi, 35 years old, is a leader of the Krinjimalar Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Melavaladi village. Rajalakshmi lives in her own house with her children and husband, Balamurugan. Her husband is a driver. Rajalakshmi has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loan on time. 

Rajalakshmi wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.

Rajalakshmi and the other member of the group are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es soltera pero tiene dos hijos ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su madre Ruth vende ropa de varón Debido al cambio de temporada Ruth desea adquirir prendas de invierno para su negocio Ruth es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y se recomienda ayudarle debido a que la ropa de invierno siempre es solicitada en un lugar tan frío como La Paz
texts.en:
Ruth is single, has two children, and lives with her parents in the city of La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to her mother.  

Ruth sells clothing for a living and because of the changing season she wants to buy winter merchandise.  She is the only bread winner in her household and needs support.  Winter clothing is always in much demand in a place as cold as La Paz.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing for her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio es soltera pero tiene un hijo Ella vive con su madre y su hermana en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticretico Rocio es medico cirujano y quiere un prestamo para pagar un diplomado en medicina Rocio es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar pero es una persona confiable y trabajadora, se recomienda otorgar el credito
texts.en: Rocio is single but has a daughter.  She lives with her mother and sister in the city of La Paz in a brick and cement house which they lease.  Rocio is a surgeon and is requesting a loan to pay for her medical diploma.  She is the only breadwinner in the household and is a trustworthy, hard-woking person who is need of this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her medical diploma.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 31 años, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder ofrecerles mejores oportunidades.
Desde hace más de 6 años viene dedicándose a la actividad agrícola. Se dedica principalmente a la producción de cacao ya que la tierra  de la zona y el clima son el ambiente adecuado para este tipo de cultivo, es por ellos que siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Andres está agradecido con los  prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá costear los gastos de mantenimiento, abono de los cultivos hasta la cosecha, de esta manera obtendrá productos de excelente calidad y seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Andres, 31, is a very hard worker who is married and lives in San Martin with his family.  His greatest motivation in life is his family and he strives every day to offer them the best opportunities he can.

For over six years he has been involved in agriculture, mainly growing cocoa because the local soil and climate are adequate for this type of crop.  Therefore, he always grows a quality product.

Andres is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he will be able to cover maintenance and fertilizer costs for his crop until harvest time.  This means he will achieve an excellent quality crop which will allow him to continue working to improve his family's quality of life and to give them a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for crop fertilizers and maintenance.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a strong and loving mother who always starts her day with a smile on her face.  She is a mother of only one son.  She is 40 and married to Ujjal, 46, who is associated with a small business. Both Saraswati and her husband attended school until grade seven.  Due to their poverty, they could not give a higher education to their only son, who now works as a daily laborer in a grill factory. They live in Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Saraswati's husband and son have no consistent income.  As a result, their income cannot provide the family with a decent lifestyle. They can hardly manage their food expenses.  Saraswati learned to stitch garments from her mother.  So to provide additional income, she has been running a small tailoring shop for the last three years.  She stitches frocks, shirts, petticoats, and blouses (ladies wear).  She has a little rented shop adjacent to her house.  She runs the business after managing her household work. Her husband helps her by purchasing raw materials from the market.  Now, with an aim to expand her business in order to supply her customers' demands and cope with the growing needs of her family, she wants to purchase a new machine, since the one she owns is old.

So she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to fulfill her dream. She hopes she will be able to stitch more garments with the help of the new machine and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rakhi

texts.en:
Rakhi is a resident of a rural region in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 28 years old and married to Krishna Kanta.  They have no children.  Rakhi studied up to grade 8 and her husband attended school until grade 12.  They could not go for higher studies due to their parents' poor economic resources.

Rakhi's husband is associated with a small business. Since her husband's income is not very stable, Rakhi works after all her chores to earn some income to support her family.  She sews garments such as frocks, petticoats, blouses, shirts etc.  She has an old sewing machine and she learned stitching from her mother.  Whatever profit she earns from selling these products is spent on household expenses.  Now, with the growing demand of her customers, she needs to expand her business by purchasing one new sewing machine.

She seeks a loan from BJS to purchase a new machine, which will enable her to stitch more garments and earn more income. She intends to expand her business to give financial sustenance to her family and a secure future.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start a tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy yam, beans and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Susmita

texts.en:
Susmita is a rural woman who is married to Satya.  She is a mother of only one son who is too young. She has an education up to grade six. They live in their own house in the small village of Anandanagar in the Jalpaiguri district.

Susmita's husband decided to start a business a few years ago in search of a steady income for running his family, which mainly consists of the sale of umbrellas.  He purchases umbrellas in large volume from different wholesale markets and supplies to the local shops. He is a very active man who knows how to carry out his work and cover his shortcomings. He needs to increase his stock.  Umbrellas are a necessity in a warm country like India.  Moreover, in the rainy season, the demand among his customers is high. Susmita is actively associated with her husband's business.  She wants to help her husband by purchasing more umbrellas.

Therefore, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase umbrellas in bulk quantities so she can sell to the customers what they demand.   This will also help to generate more income to lead a decent life. Susmita aspires to grow her business in order to secure their future and provide her son with a better education.
 
She gives her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase umbrellas in bulk quantities to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and toothpaste.

loans.name: Sarbia Raquel

texts.es: Sarbia Raquel 24 años de edad casada origen Chinandegana, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial turística, es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación un taller de tortillas y venta de leña, negocios el cual tiene ya 5 años su rutina diaria inicia desde una día antes poniendo a niquezar el maíz luego se levanta desde 4:00am a palmear las primera tanda de las deliciosas tortillas, luego la segunda tanda la inicia a las 10:00am y la ultima a tanda a las 4:00pm para cada tiempo de comida elabora 70 libras de maíz diario para la elaboración de las tortillas, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de esta localidad y sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales habitantes de su localidad,inicia su negocio con poco fondos buscando un medio digno de vivir y en ayudar con los gastos familiares del hogar, poco a poco ha ido creciendo en sus negocios pero ve la necesidad de invertir mas ya que su demanda ha crecido de clientes gracias al buen trato que ella les ofrece a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder construir los cuartos a mi Vivienda para tener mejores condiciones de vida ya que en un futuro quiero ser mamá y deseo brindarle lo mejor,  en mi Negocio quiero crecer y darle mejores condiciones de infraestructura al local de mi Negocio. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en insumos necesarios para sus negocios como: maíz, cal, leña teniendo mayor abastecimiento de insumo podre tener cubrir con la demanda de mis clientes y tendré mejores ingresos.-
texts.en:
Sarbia Raquel is 24 years old, married and comes from Chinandegana, an area known for its active tourist trade. Sarbia owns two small businesses: she makes tortillas and sells firewood in her home. She has had these businesses for five years. Sarbia starts her work the night before business, preparing the corn for the tortillas. She then wakes up at 4am in order to prepare the first batch of her delicious tortillas; she starts on the second batch at 10am, and the last at 4pm. Each day Sarbia uses around 70 lbs of corn for making the tortillas. She buys her supplies in cash at the local market, and also sells for cash. Sarbia has regular customers, and one-timers, from her local area. 

Sarbia started her business with few funds, and was looking for a decent life and help with household costs. Little by little Sarbia’s businesses have grown but she sees a need to invest more as demand has grown because of the good service that she offers. 

One of Sarbia’s dreams is to build more rooms in her home so that she can enjoy better living conditions. In the future Sarbia would like to be a mum and wants to offer her children the best that she can. At her business, she wants to expand and be fully equipped at her premises.

The aim of this loan is to invest in necessary supplies for her businesses, such as corn lime and firewood. She wants to be stocked up as best as possible in order to cover demand and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as corn, firewood, lime and more.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre de 57 años de edad casado y sin hijos.
Él es un comerciante de motos y vive en la zona de El Torno distante a dos horas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este lugar se caracteriza por sus altas temperaturas y humedad durante casi todo el año.
Andrés es un hombre de cabello gris y rostro arrugado por el paso de los años, su negocio comenzó con una moto en exposición, actualmente cuenta con tres motocicletas y necesita adquirir la cuarta moto. Sus motos son nuevas y otras usadas, él las repara y las deja en buenas condiciones para la venta, su experiencia anterior fue realizando la misma labor en una empresa, junto a sus esposa lograron independizarse y crearon una microempresa, la necesidad que tienen es la exposición de más motocicletas. Con este emprendimiento Andrés sueña darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Andrés solícita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Andrés is 57 years old, married and has children.

Andrés sells motorcycles. He lives in the El Torno area, two hours from the city of Santa Cruz. El Torno has a hot and humid climate all year round.

Andrés has grey hair, and skin that has wrinkled with the passing of the years. He started his business with one motorcycle for sale. He now has three bikes and needs a fourth one. Some of the bikes are new, others are second-hand. Andrés repairs the motorcycles and returns them to good condition for selling. Previously Andrés did this same work while working for another business. Alongside his wife, the couple was able to become independent and open a business. The couple now needs to have more motorcycles. With this business, Andrés dreams of giving his family a better life.

In order to do this, Andrés is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Jesus Divino Amor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS DIVINO AMOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, trigo y quinua.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de textiles, negocio de venta de artesania negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Jesus Divino Amor” group in the Cusco district of the province and department of the same name.

Juana is a member of the group; she is 54 years old and has one son. Juana works at her business selling cereals. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa. Juana works from 8am until 7pm. She has been doing this work for eight years and it is going very well. Juana’s dream is to have premises where she can sell her cereals. Juana is applying for a loan in order to corn, wheat and quinoa.

The other members of the group have businesses selling textiles, selling handicrafts, a grocery store and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and quinoa.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel tiene 30 años, su estado civil es soltero, y no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo, el señor vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, actualmente el y su familia viven en una casita muy antigua pero no es propia, ubicada en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba.Trabaja a diario prestando sus servicios como técnico en rayos X en un centro de médico, el destino del nuevo crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta nueva que le servirá para transportarse de su casa a su trabajo que es una distancia muy larga. Así podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Gabriel is 30 years old, single and does not have children who depend on him. Gabriel lives with his parents and siblings. The family currently lives in a very old house, but they do not own it. They live in the west of the city of Cochabamba. Gabriel works every day as an x-ray technician at a local medical centre. This loan will be used to buy a new motorcycle that will allow Gabriel to travel between his work and home. The distance between the two is quite long and this motorcycle will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre innovador, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martín junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por eso que se levanta muy temprano y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Desde hace más de 7 años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cacao el principal producto cultivado en sus terrenos. Le va muy bien porque es muy emprendedor, responsable, trabajador, y al tener amplios conocimientos sobre este cultivo puede ofrecer productos de excelente calidad.
Alberto está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos y pago por el mantenimiento hasta la etapa de la cosecha, de esta manera sus productos serán de mejor calidad y obtendrá mayores ingresos con los que podrá mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is an innovative man. He is 46 years old, married and lives with his family in San Martín.

Alberto’s greatest motivation in life is his family. It is for them that he wakes up very early and stays out late working in order to improve their quality of life.

For over seven years, Alberto has worked in farming, with his main crop being cacao. This work is going well as Alberto is very enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. Being very knowledgeable about his trade, he is able to offer products of excellent quality.

Alberto is grateful to Kiva investors as, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy fertiliser for his crops, and pay to maintain the same until the harvest season. By doing this, Alberto will have higher quality products and earn a higher income with which to increase his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilisers) for crops, and to pay to look after the same.

loans.name: Tatiana Isabel

texts.es:
Al hablar de Tatiana podemos evidenciar que es una mujer muy trabajadora y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.
Ella vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba donde convive con su esposo y sus hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.
Ella se dedica a la producción agropecuaria de plátano y yuca, es una actividad muy popular en esta región y la mayoría de habitantes obtiene sus ingresos a través de este oficio. Es una mujer trabajadora, constante y muy amante de sus hijos y además su esposo le colabora en todas sus actividades.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su negocio.
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
When speaking with Tatiana, it is clear that she is a very hard-working and helpful woman. Everything that she does is for the good and well-being of her family.

Tatiana lives in a humble house in the municipality of Valencia, in Córdoba, with her husband and children. Tatiana has fought to give her children a decent life and a good quality education.

Tatiana works in farming: she grows plantains and yucca. This is very common work in the region, where the majority of inhabitants earn an income through this trade. Tatiana is hard-working and preserving, and loves her children. Her husband supports her in her work.

Tatiana is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies. She also needs capital for her business.

Tatiana hopes that she will receive help from those with caring hearts.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: A local cassava grower in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Phally is 46 years old and a mother of two children.  She has been involved in her current business for 12 years. This is the original loan for Phally with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Now, in a group of two, she is a group leader. For Phally, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy school materials for her kids and to buy household appliances. She hopes that she can provide sufficient school materials for her kids.

loans.use: To buy school materials for her kids and household appliances

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Adiatu. She is single and has two children who are 15 and 10 years old. In 2004, Adiatu established her blouse, skirt, and ladies dress business. She saw the business as a means of developing her family faster. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,198,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Adiatu requires a loan in order to buy dresses for the Eid al-Fitri holiday. She hopes that this loan will expand her business. In the future, Adiatu plans to save more capital within the next few months to travel to China to buy more goods. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy dresses for the Eid al-Fitri holiday

loans.name: Bobson

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Bobson.  He is married and has two children who are 12 and 8 years old. In 2010, Bobson established his jeans trousers and skirts business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his living standards, especially for his children. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,050,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Bobson requires a loan in order to buy more bales of the latest jeans outfits. He hopes that this loan will change the color of his business, thus attracting more customers. In the future, Bobson plans to employ someone to start selling for him, which will boost his profit margin. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of the latest jeans outfits

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has three children who are 11, 13 and 18 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her and help her in the business.  In 2006, Fatmata established her cooking utensils business. She began her business just to be self-reliant and help her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 902,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan to buy food flasks, plastic rubber bowls and plastic cups. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ladies dresses

loans.name: Daniel Damour

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Daniel.  He is separated and has two children who are 10 and 9 years old. He has two additional dependents, In 2013, Daniel established his video and audio cassettes, drinks and cosmetics business. He began his business because he wanted to fulfill great dreams. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are boys and girls. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Daniel requires a loan in order to buy more audio and video cassettes, drinks and cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will increase his turnover so that the business will expand. In the future, Daniel plans to do wholesale and get into the fast food business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for audio and video cassette, drinks and cosmetics

loans.name: Sao I.

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Sao.  She is married and has four children who are 4, 6, 8 and 18 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help with her education. In 2007, Sao established her used clothing business. She began her business just to be self-reliant and to help her husband run the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,392,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Sao has already received and successfully repaid five loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy one bale of used shirts and one bale of used ladies blouses. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Sao plans to expand her business to other areas of the town. “She started in a stall, now owns a shop”. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Elba es una mujer emprendedora que ha trabajado durante 10 años en su negocio, la socia se dedica a la venta de cepillos, escobillones y todo tipo de artículos de limpieza, doña Elba cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual colabora económicamente y también le ayuda con las ventas. Con el crédito doña Elba quiere invertir en la compra de materiales para su venta ya que una de sus sueños  es comprar un microbús y vender también en los departamentos. Gracias a los créditos que se le han otorgado la socia ha aumentado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Elba is an enterprising woman who has worked in her business for 10 years. The member sells scrub brushes, brooms, and all types of cleaning supplies. Doña Elba has the help of her husband, who contributes financially and also helps her with sales. 

With the loan, Doña Elba wants to invest in the purchase of materials for her shop, as one of her dreams is to purchase a minibus and sell in the departments also. Thanks to the loans that have been given to her, the member has increased her sales.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Palawan, Philippines. She is 42 years old and has a child who is currently in school. She and Darlito, her husband, manage a fruit stand business, and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures. Analyn’s family was one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.
Analyn buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells mangoes, coconut, avocados, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 
Analyn is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.
In the future, Analyn hopes to improve and grow her business. She also dreams of giving the best for her child's education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Khamala Caitlen

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Khamala Caitlen has been engaged in a variety store business within her community for almost three years now. She is 27 years of age and blessed with three children. Her husband, Raymundo, helps her in the business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Khamala Caitlen wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Khamala Caitlen hopes to grow her business and desires to give her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en:
Janeta, a 26-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Manila, Philippines, has run her direct selling business for nine years, and she makes a good income from this. She is married, and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs.
She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.
Due to financial insufficiency, Janeta wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.
Besides growing her business, Janeta hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines and she is 48 years old. She is married to Jimmy, a retired soldier and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Sonia sells different tools and accessories mostly used in jeepneys. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community and jeepney drivers. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of different tools to expand her product inventory.

Sonia dreams that her business will continue to grow and have more customers. She hopes to have a better living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more tools to sell

loans.name: Jovid

texts.ru:
Човид молодой и жизнерадостный парень двадцати четырёх лет.  Он совсем недавно женился.  Проживает  Човид с молодой женой в городе. Высшего образования у Човида нет  и его супруга тоже без высшего образования.  Она в данный момент является домохозяйкой. Помогает маме Човида по хозяйству. Човид имеет собственную легковую машину.
 
Човид работает частным таксистом, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание. Он развозит пассажиров. От этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Ему нравится его работа, нравится  всегда быть в пути, встречаться с разными людьми. Сейчас Човид хочет произвести капитальный ремонт соей машины, так как она уже давно работает, и некоторые запчасти устарели. Для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Но так как у него не имеется достаточной суммы денег на данный момент, он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку запчастей для ремонта своей машины. Човид заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и верит в положительный результат.
texts.en: Jovid is a young and cheerful 24-year-old man.  He recently got married and he lives with his young wife in the city.  Neither Jovid nor his wife have a higher education.  His wife is currently a homemaker - she stays home and helps Jovid's mother around the house.  Jovid has his own small car and he works as a taxi driver to earn a steady income for their living expenses.  He drives passengers around and he earns a good income from this business.  Jovid likes his work, he enjoys being on the road and meeting all kinds of people.  He now wants to make major repairs to his car, as it has been on the road for a long time and a few parts have become worn.  He needs money to do this, but he doesn't have enough at the moment, which is why he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy auto parts to make these repairs to his car.  Jovid thanks Arvand in advance for their support and he believes that his loan will have a good outcome.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 48 years old, widowed, and has children. As a way of generating income, she has engaged in a variety store business within her community for years now. She works hard to provide for her everyday needs, and especially her children's.
In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
To increase her product inventory as well as improve her sales, Gemalyn would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 (Philippines pesos) which she will be utilizing to buy additional grocery items. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.
Gemalyn hopes that she will soon have her own grocery store. She dreams of financial security particularly for her children's education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru: Мунаввархон очень трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она уже более 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Мунаввархон начала свой бизнес приготовлением и продажей самбусы и разнообразных сладостей у себя дома. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она обладает кафе-бистро. Ее кафе расположено у входа местного рынка. Мунаввархон готовит пиццу у себя в кафе и продает местном жителям. Так как ее кафе расположено у входа местного рынка, ее кафе посещают много людей. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Они воспитывают 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Мунаввархон очень заботливая мать. Она нуждается новой духовке и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munavvarkhon is a very hard-working and cheerful woman who has run her own business for more than five years.  She started her business baking and selling samosas at her home and she has increased her business little by little.  Munavvarkhon currently has her own cafe-bistro which is located in the local market, where she bakes pizzas and sells them to the local people.  Because her cafe is located near the local market, she serves a lot of customers.  Her husband helps her run her business, and they are raising three young children together.  Munavvarkhon is a very attentive mother.  She needs a new oven and with that goal in mind, she has asked for a loan of $600.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her cafe

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 59, resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She also has an apartment, and she is a jeepney operator for additional income.
Nenita maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 
Nenita hopes to have a bigger network and dreams that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Фариды - средне-специальное образование, в данное время не работает. Супруг Фариды работает главным специалистом отдела попечительства семьи и детей, однако его заработной платы не хватает на содержание семьи, поэтому Фарида занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Стартовав 25 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Фариды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок и 8 овец.  Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 2,70 ГА, где Фарида выращивает ячмень. Члены семьи в свободное время активно помогают по хозяйству, а также в реализации молока. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фарида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, увеличив тем самым объемы реализуемого молока, а также для покупки бычков с целью их откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита позволят Фариде развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи, а также приобрести так необходимый семье автомобиль.
texts.en:
Farida is 47 years old and she is married with three children.  She has a high school education and she is currently working.  Her husband works as a chief specialist of family and child welfare, but his income is not enough to support his own family, which is why Farida works as a farmer to supplement the household income.  She started her agricultural work 25 years ago and thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one dairy cow, one bull and eight sheep.  They also have a 2.7 hectare plot of land, where Farida grows barley.

Farida's family members actively help her around the house, as well as with the milk production.  Their monthly income is 3,500 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing their business, Farida has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy cows so she can increase her milk production, as well as to buy bulls to fatten up and resell.  The income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, improve her family's living standard, and to buy the car her family needs.

loans.use: To buy cow for growing the milk selling and to purchase steers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines, and she is 31 years old. She is married to Mark Anthony, an employee, and has children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. She has a variety store and a small canteen for additional income.
Irene operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, and resell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular in size. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.
Irene hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving a good future to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Flora May

texts.en:
Flora May is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and four of her children are currently in school.
Flora May is in the agricultural business and pig fattening in the Philippines. Flora May requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business.
Flora May has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed three times from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Flora May would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias, una de ellas la coordinadora doña Rosa es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que lleva7 años en su negocio el cual le ayuda a mantener a sus dos hijos de 18 y 11 años, la socia se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y ropa usada. La socia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual le ayuda económicamente y también a hacer las compras.  Con el crédito doña Rosa quiere invertir en la compra de más productos para aumentar el negocio y lograr superarse. Gracias a los créditos ha logrado aumentar sus ventas. Otra de las socias doña Aimee de 35 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas y cuajadas, la señora Michelle de 35 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes Avon y ropa, doña Silvia de 46 años se dedica a la costura.
texts.en: This support group is made up of four members. One of them is the coordinator, Rosa. She is a strong and enterprising woman who has had her business for 7 years. It helps her support her two children, aged 18 and 11. She works selling clothing shoes, and used clothing. She has her husband's help. He helps her financially and also with making the purchases. With the loan, Rosa wants to invest in buying more products to grow her business and get ahead. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her sales. Another one of the members, Aimee, is 35. She sells tortillas and curds. Michelle is 35 and she sells Avon perfume and clothing. Silvia is 46 and she sews.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Laurel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias, una de ella la coordinadora doña Maura de 56 años es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja en su negocio desde hace 5 años y el cual le ayuda a mantener a su hijo de 14 años que aun  dependen de ella, la socia se dedica a atender un cafetín ubicado dentro de un colegio Cuenta solo con la ayuda de su hijo el cual estudia en el mismo colegio y este en recreo sale a ayudarla, con el crédito doña Maura invertirá en la compra de más productos que le ayuden a surtir el negocio y comprar ropa para luego vendérsela a los profesores  y lograr superarse.  Gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido la socia se ha ayudado en la compra de sus medicamentos ya que no cuenta con seguro médico, también le ha ayudado con los estudios de su hijo y a hacer mejoras en la casa. Otra de las socias la señora Ana de 29 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, doña Margarita de 64 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y zapatos.
texts.en: The support group is made up of three members. One of them is the coordinator, Maura. She is an enterprising woman who has worked in her business for 5 years. It helps her support her 14 year old son who still depends on her. She runs a cafe located in a school. She only has the help of her son who goes to the same school and during his break goes to help her. With the loan, Maura will invest in buying more products that will help her stock her business  and buy clothes that she will later sell to the teachers so that she can get ahead. Thanks to the loans that she has taken out, she has been able to to buy medications, since she doesn't have health insurance. They have also helped with her son's education and in doing home improvements. Another one of the members is Ana, aged 29. She sells clothing and perfume. Margarita is 64 and she sells new clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school. In the picture, Helen is with her husband who helps her in her business.

Helen has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

Helen has been in this business for 3 years. Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, and condiments

loans.name: Tomanina

texts.en:
Tomanina is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Taguig City, Philippines. She is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Solly, her husband, works as a driver and helps her to provide for their needs. She manages a business buying and selling ready-to-wear products, and her income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenses.

What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and eye-wear to footwear and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Tomanina is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue.

In the future, she hopes to have her own stall for her business. She also desires her children to be able to complete their studies as well as to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 60 years old and married with five children.

Linda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, coffee, noodles, seasonings, sugar, etc. to sell.

Linda has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

Linda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, coffee, noodles, seasonings, sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and vegetable oil

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
Dora tiene 32 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta 5° grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian y uno es mucho menor, ella trabaja haciendo tortillas para vender desde hace unos 7 años. 

Ella comenzó este tipo de negocio pues tenía que mantener a sus hijos y eso lo aprendió desde muy pequeña cuando vivía con sus padres y lo vio como una fuente de ingresos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz , leña y gas para seguir con su negocio de tortillas. 

Dora sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales aunque dice respeta la decisión de ellos ya que apenas comienzan a estudiar.
texts.en: Dora is 32 years old. She studied only up to 5th grade. She is a single mother of 3 children. Two of them are studying and one is a lot younger. She has worked for some 7 years making tortillas. She started this type of business because she had to support her children, and she learned it since very young  when she lived with her parents and she saw it as a source of income. She needs the loan to buy corn, fire log and gas in order to continue with her tortilla business. Dora dreams of her children being professionals, although she respects their decision since they just started studying.

loans.use: to buy corn, fire log and gas in order to continue with her tortilla business.

loans.name: Lory Bel

texts.en:
Lory Bel is 37 years old and has two children. Lory Bel is married and has two children who are in school.

Lory Bel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lory Bel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lory Bel has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lory Bel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda, 48, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Blesilda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Blesilda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of chicharon, ampao (local delicacies) and others to sell.

In the future, Blesilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of chicharon, ampao and other to sell.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela works hard to support her family.

Lowela is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lowela has been in this business for 27 years now.

Lowela requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Lowela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used buy more vegetables and other products needed in her store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase more vegetables and other products needed in her store. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to improve their living condition. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and single. Maricel works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from home and beauty products retailing. 

Maricel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cereals, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Maricel aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cereals, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene, 47, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marlene has a general store business in the Philippines. Marlene has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is married and she works hard to support her family. 

Bernadith has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bernadith has been in this business for 10 years now.

Bernadith requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her business.

In the future, Bernadith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Angelisa

texts.en:
Angelisa, 40, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelisa has a banana vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Angelisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

In the future, Angelisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marli est une commerçante depuis 3 ans, trésorière et membre d’une association d’affaires «La Promesse», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des divers articles manufacturés et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle installe son business à domicile dans une boutique. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima  pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est un technicien charpentier. Elle va acheter des cartons savons de toilette, des cartons de bombons, des biscuits,  sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir, elle compte achever sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The client Marli has been a retail merchant for the past three years. She is a member and the treasurer of "La Promesse", a dynamic business association. A 30-year-old entrepreneur, married with four children, two of whom attend school and the other two are still too young.

She sells miscellaneous manufactured articles and is shareholder of a shop, into which she moved her home-based business.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She started with funds received from her husband, who is a carpentry technician.

She will buy cartons of toilet soap, boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, soap powders, cosmetics, one box of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

In the future, she hopes to complete building her house, educate and feed their children, and ensure their medical care.

She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy cartons of toilet soap, boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, soap powders, cosmetics, 1 box of notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Muzirenzusa Group

texts.fr: Madame  Nzigire est  membre  du groupe de credit  Muzirenzusa.  Elle est âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un homme  d’affaire  et  ensemble ils  ont  6 enfants  dont seulement  5 étudient.  Le nouveau  prêt sollicité va acheter  400 kg de café. Le plus grand problème de son métier  c’est la fluctuation de prix. Son objectif  est  de se constituer une épargne assez importante pour accéder  à un credit superieur ou égal à 1000$ est ainsi asseoir son activité. Ainsi, elle remercie  Hekima de soutenir les femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Nzigire is a member of the Muzirenzusa credit group.  She is 40 years old and married to a business man.  Nzigire and her husband have six children, five of whom are in school.  With this new loan, Nzigire will buy 400 kilos of coffee.  Her main professional challenge is price fluctuations.  Her goal is to save enough money to gain access to a loan equal to or higher than $1,000, which would allow her to really establish her business.  She thanks Hekima for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 400 kilos of coffee.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, a 45-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines, has run her video/karaoke shop for almost 20 years, and she makes a good income from this. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs. 

Virginia provides a place in her house to be used by customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine. She and her husband also operate a billiard house and offer welding service in their barangay. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Virginia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use for the maintenance of her videoke machine. She will use her loan to improve her profit and her additional revenue to improve the general living condition of her family.

She hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She also desires to become rich and purchase her own car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her   video/karaoke machine and improve their service.

loans.name: Akili Group

texts.fr: La cliente Fatuma est presidente de l’association de crédit Akili. Agée de 53 ans, elle est mère de 8 enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Mariée à un agent de l’Etat, elle loue un dépôt dans lequel elle vend les braises et ce pour cette raison qu’elle  sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 47 sacs de braise et ainsi constituer son stock. Son rêve est de devenir un grand fournisseur des braises du marché central. Au final, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir abondamment.
texts.en:
Fatuma is the president of the loan association 'Akili'. She is 53 years old and mother to eight children who are all following a path through education.  Fatuma is married to a civil servant.  She rents a depot where she sells charcoal.  This is why she has requested this new loan, in order to buy 47 sacks of charcoal to build up her stocks.

Fatuma's dream is to become a large supplier of charcoal at the central market.

She is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima, and prays to God that He will bless them abundantly.

loans.use: to buy 47 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hazina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kalunga  est  membre  dans le groupe de credit  Hazina. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 57ans, mère de 9 enfants scolarisés  et est mariée à un homme instituteur de la place.  Elle sollicite le nouveau credit pour acheter 11casiers de limonades et 15casiers de boissons alcoolisées.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires, rehabiliter sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de les soutenir.
texts.en: Kalunga is a member of the Hazina Group. This dynamic woman is a 57-year-old mother of nine children, who are all enrolled in school, and is married to a local primary school teacher. She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase 11 creates of non-alcoholic beverages and 15 crates of alcoholic beverages. She would like her business to do well, to renovate her home and to be able to pay for her children's educations. She would like to thank Hekima for supporting her group.

loans.use: to purchase 11 creates of lemonade and 15 crates of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Sacristin Group

texts.fr: Mulondanyi est une brave commerçante depuis 23 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Sacristin», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 3 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché du centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 400 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite achever sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en  apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Mulondanyi has been an honest retailer for 23 years. She is a member of the business group “Sacristin”; she is a senior entrepreneur, 50 years old, married and the mother of nine children. Six of her children are studying and three are married. She sells used shoes, and she displays her business at a market in the center of town. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her activity. She will buy 400 pairs of shoes. Her spouse is a civil servant in public administration. She started with funds received from her husband. In the future, she would like to finish her house, keep her children in school and feed them. She thanks Hekima to have well chosen its target, providing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, while granting them loans without collateral.

loans.use: to buy 400 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines and he is 58 years old. He is married to Jocelyn, who helps him in his business, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Angelito sells Yakult, a probiotic dairy product made by fermenting a mixture of skimmed milk and a special strain of the bacterium, Lactobacillus casei Shirota. His regular customers are his neighbors, the local community and jeepney drivers. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more Yakult needed in his business.

Angelito hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have better living conditions. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more Yakult needed in his business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 56 years old, married, and has one child. Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from direct sales of personal products. 

Ofelia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. Ofelia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ofelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 52 years old and married with three children.

Constancia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, canned goods, detergent soap, and other groceries to sell.

Constancia has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rug-making.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Constancia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, canned goods, detergent soap, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Eriquita

texts.en:
Eriquita is 50 years old and married with eight children. With three children currently in school, Eriquita works very hard to provide for them.

Eriquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Eriquita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, hair conditioner, detergent soap, coffee, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Eriquita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family.  Evelyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 45 years old and married with four children.  

Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for 3 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 50 years old and married with six children. Felicidad works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soft-drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, candies, etc. to sell.

Felicidad has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, candies, etc. 

Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, soft-drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias, una de ella es la coordinadora  doña Maritza, es una mujer emprendedora que lleva 8 años trabajando en su negocio el cual le ayuda a mantener a su hijo de 5 años, la socia se dedica a atender una pulpería y esta cuenta con la ayuda de sus esposo el cual le ayuda a vender y a hacer las compras necesarias para mantener el negocio. Con el crédito doña Maritza invertirá en su negocio para lograr seguir adelante y llegar a construir su casa ya que cuenta con unos terrenos. Con los créditos que ha obtenido invirtió en su negocio pero también en hacer mejoras en su casa. Otra de las socias es doña Lidia de 36 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa, la señora Alma de 41 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, frijoles y leche agria. Doña Yamileth de 34 años se dedica a la venta de nacatamal y hielo en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of 4 members, one of whom is Maritza, the coordinator. She is an enterprising woman with 8 years experience working in her business. Past loans have helped her maintain her 5-year-old son. Maritza runs a general store and can count on the help of her husband who assists with sales and makes the purchases necessary to maintain the business.

With this loan, Maritza will invest in her business in order to forge ahead and arrive at the possibility of constructing a new house, now that she has some land. Previous loans have enabled her to invest in her business and, also, to make improvements to her present home.

The other members of the group are Lidia, 36 years old, who sells clothing; Alma, 41 years old, who sells tortillas, beans, and buttermilk; and Yamileth, 34 years old, who sells “nacatamal” (Nicaraguan tamales) and ice in her home.

loans.use: buy more products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Las Chipas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta integrado por cuatro socias, una de ellas es la coordinadora  doña Mónica es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja en su negocio desde hace 4 años y el cual le ayuda a mantener a tres hijos que aun dependen de ella, la socia se dedica a vender tortillas, frijoles cocidos, gallo pinto, leche agria. Cuenta solo con la ayuda de una muchacha que vende, cocina y le ayuda con las compras.
