Con el crédito doña Mónica quiere invertir en la comprar de más productos como harina, maíz, frijoles, arroz, leña  que le ayuden a surtir el negocio para aumentar sus ventas y lograr superarse.  Gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido antes logro hacerle mejoras a su casa. Otra de las socias es la señora Xiomara de 43 años que se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, doña Maria de 42 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas y doña Magdaliz de 36 años se dedica a atender una pulpería.
texts.en:
This loan group is made up of four members. One of them, Monica, serves as the group coordinator. She is an enterprising woman who has worked for the past 4 years selling tortillas, cooked beans, gallo pinto (a typical bean and rice dish), and fermented milk. She has a helper who works in cooking and sales, and also helps her to buy ingredients. With this loan, Monica wants to invest in the purchase of more products to use in cooking, like flour, corn, beans, rice, and firewood. This will help her to vary the kinds of foods she sells to increase her earnings and to improve her situation. Thanks to previous loans she was able to make improvements to her home.

The other members are Xiomara, who is 43 years old and sells nacatamales (a type of tamale popular in Central America); Maria, who is 42 years old and sells tortillas and pupusas (a typical Central American dish); and Magdaliz, who is 36 and works in a small grocery store.

loans.use: buy products like flour, corn, beans, rice, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gaudiosa is 47 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Gaudiosa has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap material to sell.

Gaudiosa has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap material to sell

loans.name: Jenave

texts.en:
Jenave works hard to support her family. She is married and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Jenave requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like bamboo, rope, etc. for her business.

Jenave has been in this business for 10 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like bamboo, rope, etc. for her business

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonita is 39 years old and her three children are in school.

Leonita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leonita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marcia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marcia is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers for her dried fish vending business.

Marcia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melian

texts.en:
Melian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Melian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, etc. for her business.

Melian has been in this business for 30 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been in the business of slaughtering domestic pigs for more than ten years and she earns well from doing this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

Lanie would like to apply for a new loan for she wants to increase the capital being used for her business. With PHP 35,000, she could purchase more pigs and even improve her revenue from her poultry business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Lanie desires to expand her business and dreams of giving her family a better future. She meets up with her fellowship group members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional chicken and pigs needed in her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa es una señora emprendedora de 51 años de edad,  actualmente vive con su esposo ya que sus hijos crecieron y  se independizaron, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, Narcisa casi toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio desde que era muy joven salia a vender golosinas, hoy en día vende productos agrícolas.

Narcisa se ha dedicado a las ventas, desde que tenia 14 años salia a vender golosinas, pan y tamales que elaboraba su madre.


Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en la tienda que piensa abrir la cual establecerá en la escuela de la ciudad.

Narcisa desea seguir trabajando y sobre todo estar bien de salud para que no le falten los ánimos para trabajar.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 51, is an enterprising woman.  Currently she lives with her husband because her children grew up and became independent.

Narcisa earns a living making tamales.  She has devoted almost her entire life to commerce, going out to sell snacks since she was very young.  Now she sells agricultural products.  Narcisa has earned a living in sales since she was 14.  She used to sell snacks, bread, and tamales that her mother makes.

She needs the loan to invest in the store she plans to open in the city school.

Narcisa wants to keep on working and, above all, stay healthy so she has the energy to work.

loans.use: to invest in the store she plans to open

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta integrado por cuatro socias una de ellas es la coordinadora doña Pastora es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha estado al frente de su negocio desde hace 10 años, la socia se dedica a vender ropa, perfumes y productos por encargo. La socia con el crédito planea invertirlo en comprar camisas, shorts, pantalones, camisetas para luego ir a revenderlos, con esto doña Pastora podrá aumentar sus ventas e ingresos con lo que luego invertirá en poner su propia tienda. Gracias a los créditos anteriores la socia ha podido mantener su negocio y hacer sus compras. Otra de las socias es doña Fanny de 29 años se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, frescos y cerveza, la señora Pascuala de 50 años se dedica a atender una mini pulpería y Doña Yansis de 29 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada
texts.en:
This loan group has four members. One of them, Pastora, serves as the group coordinator. Pastora is a strong and enterprising woman who has been in charge of her own business for 10 years, selling clothing, perfume and other products that her customers request. With this loan, she plans to buy shirts, shorts, pants, and t-shirts to sell, and by doing this she hopes to increase her sales and invest in opening a store. Thanks to earlier loans she has been able to keep her business going and buy merchandise.

The other members of the group are Fanny, who is 29 and works selling soft drinks, juice and beer; Pascuala, who is 50 and works at a small grocery store; and Yansis, who is 29 and works selling new and used clothing.

loans.use: buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima works hard to support her family. Zosima is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Zosima has requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business.

Zosima has been in this business for 28 years now.

Zosima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Diana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diana has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie, age 39, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, detergent soap, biscuits, candies, eggs, and noodles. 

She and her husband have one child, who attends school. She works very hard to help provide for her family.

Emie requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her general store.

In the future, Emie would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, age 50, who is a resident of Palawan in the Philippines. She is a mother of two and she manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide an income for her family's everyday expenses. Ma. Theresa and her family members were affected by the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what they lost.

Ma. Theresa operates a retail business. She buys dried squid and other products from wholesalers and then sells them to customers for a profit. She also manages a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales daily.

To help her continue operating her business, Theresa is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of dried squid and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Theresa dreams of being able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Espedita

texts.en:
Espedita, age 29, buys and sells dry goods to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

Espedita requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy an inventory of dry goods to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of dry goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: Chitema est une femme d’affaires et membre  d’une  banque villageoise «Ufalme»,entrepreneur, âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 scolarisé et 3 sont grands. La cliente est vendeuse d’haricots. Elle étale sa marchandise sur la rue dans un quartier commercial  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint est un hôtelier.Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de  l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Chitema is a business woman and a member of a ’banc villageois’ called “Ufalme”. An entrepreneur, she is 55 years old and a married mother of seven children, of whom four are in school, and three are adults. This client is a vendor of beans. She displays her merchandise on the streets in the business district in her town. She started in business with funds from Hekima. Her husband is a hotelkeeper. She has been in this business for four years. This new loan will be used to purchase 2 sacks of beans. Thus, she wishes to provide education, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time post-conflict in the country’s east.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of beans

loans.name: El Delfin Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias, una de ellas es la coordinadora doña Eugenia es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha trabajado en su negocio desde hace 3 años el cual le ayuda a mantener a su hijo de 13 años, la socia se dedica  atender una pulpería. Cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo y además le ayudar a vender y a realizar las compras. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de más productos como gaseosa, reposterías, chiverías, granos básicos, sopas instantáneas etc. para tener más variedad. Con los créditos que ha obtenido la socia ha crecido y ha logrado aumentar sus ventas. Otra de sus socias es la señora Sara de 37 años que se dedica a la venta de rutas y verduras, doña Elena de 24 años vende de manera ambulante en su comunidad y doña Eudes de 36 años se dedica  la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is composed of four members. Eugenia, the coordinator, is a strong and enterprising woman who has worked in her business, a grocery store, for 3 years, which helps her support her 13-year-old son. She has the financial support of her husband, and he also helps her to sell and to make purchases. With this loan she will invest in buying more products like soda, pastries, snacks, grains, instant soups, etc, to have more variety. With previous loans, she has grown her business and increased her sales. 
The other members of the group are Sara, 37, who sells fruits and vegetables; Elena, 24, a street vendor who sells in her community, and Eudes, 36, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more products like soda, pastries, snacks, grains, instant soups, etc.

loans.name: Llegaremos A La Meta Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias, una de ellas es la coordinadora doña María es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha estado al frente de su negocio desde hace 14 años, la socia se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos usados. Con el crédito la socia planea invertir en la compra de más productos como camisas, pantalones, camisolas, chinelas etc. Con esto podrá surtir y reforzar el negocio, o los ingresos de las ventas quiere mejorar y ampliar su casa, con lo créditos que ha logrado obtener la socia se ha ayudado económicamente. Otra de las socias es doña Margarita de 36 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, la señora Idalia de 36 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, doña Mikell de 22 años se dedica a la venta de artículos escolares, ropa y zapatos
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of four members. One of them, the coordinator is María, a strong and enterprising woman who has been at the front of her business for 14 years. She works selling clothing and used shoes. She plans to invest the loan in buying more products like shirts, pants, sports jerseys, flip-flops etc. Doing this she can stock and strengthen her business. She wants to make improvements and expand her house with the profits. The other loans she has been granted have helped her economically.

The other members are Margarita who is 36 years old who sells clothing and cosmetics. Idalia is 36 years old and sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics and Mikell who is 22 years old and sells school supplies, clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine, 44, a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is a mother of three, and she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Catherine oversees and owns a tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle, as well as to maintain the motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Catherine dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of tricycle

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyamwishi est commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Safi», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 3 qui sont encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse  des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise dans le marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 20 kg d’arachides, 25 kg de fretins et 30 kg de tomates. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: This client, Nyamwishi, is a merchant and a member of the business group Safi. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 32 years old and a married mother of five children, of whom 2 are students, and 3 are still very young. She sets up her merchandise at a market in town. She started in business with initial capital from her husband. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for five years. This new loan will be used to purchase 20 kg of peanuts, 25 kg of small fish, and 30 kg of tomatoes. Thus, she wishes to grow her business. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 20 kg of peanuts, 25 kg of small fish, and 30 kg of tomatoes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, age 46, farms sugarcane to earn an income. She has been engaged in this agricultural activity for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She and her husband have six children, two of whom are still in school.

Gloria requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Gloria would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta integrado por tres socias, una de ellas es la coordinadora doña Lorena es una mujer fuerte, emprendedora que ha estado al frente de su negocio desde hace 12 años, la socia se dedica a palmear tortillas y vender tortilla en su propia tortillería. Con este negocio doña Lorena se ayuda para mantener a sus hijos de 14 y 17 años. La socia cuenta con la ayuda de unas muchachas que palmean tortillas, con el crédito doña Lorena quiere comprar productos que necesita para su negocio como leña y maíz para aumentar sus ventas y con los ingresos poder ampliar su casa. Gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido ha logrado mantenerse económicamente y lograr invertir en su negocio. Otra de las socias es doña Zoyla de 42 años se dedica a la vente de ropa nueva y usada, la señora Flor de 46 años se dedica a la venta de fritanga
texts.en:
This loan group has three members. One of them, Lorena, serves as the group coordinator. Lorena is a strong and enterprising woman who has been in charge of her own business for 12 years, making and selling tortillas in her own shop. This business helps Lorena provide for her children, who are 14 and 17 years old. She also has helpers in her shop who help with making the tortillas. With this loan, Lorena plans to buy supplies that she needs, like firewood and corn, in order to increase her sales and use the profits to add on to her house. Thanks to earlier loans she has been able to provide for herself and invest in her business.

The other members of the group are Zoyla, who is 42 and works selling new and used clothing, and Flor, who is 46 and works selling fried foods.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Kyeshero Institut Group

texts.fr: Le client Rushigi est un homme d’affaires et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Kyeshero Institut», entrepreneur, âgé de 47 ans, marié et père de 9 enfants, tous étudient. Il est vendeur divers matériels de construction. Son épouse est un manager. Il étale ses business dans un centre commercial de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter divers matériels de plomberie et construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Il débuta  avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir, il souhaite  construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux entrepreneurs gagnes petits exclus du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
This client, Rushigi, is a businessman and a member of the business collective “Kyeshero Institut”. An entrepreneur, he is 47 years old and a married father of nine children, of who all are students. He is a vendor of a variety of construction supplies and equipment. His spouse is a manager. He sets up his business at a commercial center in town. He is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow his business. He is going to purchase a variety of plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, screens, nails, cables, sheetmetal, etc.) He had started off with funds from his parents. 

For the future, he wishes to build a house and provide education and food for his children. He thanks Hekima for supporting small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system by according them no-collateral loans.

loans.use: to purchase various plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, screens, nails, cables, sheetmetal, etc.)

loans.name: Luchando Por Las Mujeres Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario integrado por tres socias una de ellas es la coordinadora doña Gloria es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha estado al frente de su negocio desde hace 6 años, la socia se dedica a vender tortillas, enchiladas, tajadas con queso. Con el crédito doña Gloria planea invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, arroz, aceite harina, huevos, cerdo, carne etc. La socia quiere aumentar sus ventas para que  los ingresos le ayuden a ampliar el local. Con ayuda de los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente ha logrado mantenerse y mejorar su casa. Otra de las socias es doña Maritza de 41 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la señora Anielka de 36 años se dedica a la venta de leña y golosinas.
texts.en: This communal bank is composed of three members. One of them the coordinator is Gloria who is a strong and enterprising woman who has been at the front of her business for 6 years. She works selling tortillas, enchiladas and cheese tajadas (fried plantains). Gloria plans to invest the loan in buying corn, wood, rice, flour, flour, eggs, pork, beef, etc. She wants to expand her sales so that the profits can be used to help her expand her sales location. With the help of the previous loans she has manged to support herself and make improvements on her house. The other members are Maritza who is 41 years old and sells tortillas and Anielka who is 36 years old and works selling wood and sweets.

loans.use: to buy corn. wood, rice, oil, flour, eggs, pork, beef, etc.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn, age 45 and widowed, weaves and sells scarves to earn an income. She lives in the province of Takeo with her two children, both of whom are employed as factory laborers. The family together can earn approximately $18 per day.

She would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for the family to use for commuting to work. This loan will help her reduce her family’s transportation expenses. 

In the future, Yoeurn hopes that she can eventually afford to repair and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for the family to use for commuting to work

loans.name: Muharama

texts.ru: Мухарама добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась и выросла в столице Таджикистана. Она не имела возможности поступить в университет и получить высшее образование, так как ее родители были бедными людьми. Мухарама данное время мать 3 детей. Ее муж простой рабочий. Мухарама более 2 лет занимается выпечкой и продажей лепешек. Она упорно трудится с раннего утра и работа у нее тяжелая. Несколько дней назад в ее семье произошла несчастье. Умер ее отец. Они должны провести его похороны, однако не имеют денег. Мухарама запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения похороны отца. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muharama is a kind and determined woman who was born and raised in Tajikistan's capital city. She did not have the opportunity to go to university and get a higher education because her parents were poor people. Muharama is the mother of three children and her husband is a working man. She has been selling pastries and cakes for over two years. She works hard and her day begins early in the morning. It is difficult work. A few days ago something unfortunate happened in her family. Her father died. They need to hold a funeral ceremony but do not have the money. Muharama is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to hold her father's funeral. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your support.

loans.use: To organize a funeral ceremony for her deceased father

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, age 48 and widowed, earns a living from farming. She would like to open an ice cream shop. This new business will allow her to earn additional income with which to support her family.

Srey lives in the province of Takeo with her two children, both of whom are employed as factory laborers. The family together can earn approximately $13 per day.

She would like to apply for a loan the amount of $1,000, which she will use to open her ice cream shop. 

In the future, she hopes someday to build a new house.

loans.use: To open an ice cream shop

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lu Thi Dien, born in 1969, is Thai ethnic people.  She is living with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family has 5 members including the couple with two sons and one daughter. They are all obedient and hard working.  Her eldest son is married and has a beautiful son, while the remain children are living with the couple.
	
The main income of her family is primarily based on breeding and cultivation. This source of income is just enough to cover her family’s basic expenses and not enough to buy fertilizer for next season. Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coming season. She and her husband will try to find extra jobs to earn money to repay M7-MFI on time. She expects the loan will help her family have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coming season

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: El señor Santiago, vive y trabaja en Tiraque; económicamente es independiente, trabajador y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, haba y avena como principales productos en su terreno propio con una extensión de 1 hectárea, el mismo lo recibio como herencia de sus padres.  Produce todo con rotación de cultivos tiene una experiencia de 5 años en el sector agrícola, cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico(gallinaza), semillas agrícolas para la siembra y productos agroquímicos ya que quiere proveerse de estos insumos porque se acerca la época de siembra, de esta forma incrementará su producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorarán su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Santiago lives and works in Tiraque. Economically he is independent and he is a hard-worker and responsible. He works in agriculture growing potatoes, broad beans and oats as principal products on his own land of one hectare in size. He got this as an inheritance from his parents. He gets his crops through rotation and he has 5 years of experience in agriculture. He also has 3 cattle to fatten. Currently he needs a loan to buy organic manure (chicken droppings) seeds to grow and agrochemical products. He wants to acquire all these products as the time to seed is approaching. Doing this he will increase his production and enjoy better sales to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy organic manure (from poultry), seeds and agrochemical products.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, age 65 and widowed, is a farmer. She lives in the province of Takeo with her two children, both of whom are employed as factory workers. The family together can earn approximately $13 per day.

Mon would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for the family to use to commute to work. This loan will help her reduce her family’s transportation expense. 

In the future, she hopes that she can open a tailoring shop for her daughter, as well as to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for the family to use to commute to work

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja y es madre de dos hijos.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de carácter fuerte y hábil para las negociaciones, su simpatía le permite conquistar a sus clientes y fidelizarlos para que retornen una y otra vez.
Su negocio principal es una tienda de barrio que atiende de lunes a lunes hasta altas horas de la noche, ella tiene la necesidad de abastecer su negocio semanalmente.
Emiliana es de tez morena cabellos negros y manos fuertes, su carácter es de una persona sencilla de buen trato al cliente, recientemente comenzó con un nuevo emprendimiento; la venta de empanadas caseras a las afueras de su tienda, ya cuenta con clientela y su negocio prospera.
Sus hijos ya terminaron la escuela secundaria, piensan en continuar sus estudios para ayudar a su madre.
Es por esos motivos que Emiliana solicita un préstamos para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda y sus empanadas.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a 41 year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She is the mother of 2 children.

Emiliana is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has a strong character and is skilled at negotiations.  She wins over her customers with her friendliness, and she earns their loyalty so that they will return time after time.  She has a neighborhood store that she tends to every day until the late hours of the night.  She needs to stock up her store every week. 

Emiliana has a dark complexion, black hair and strong hands.  Her character is that of an unassuming person who treats her customers well.  She recently started a new economic activity; she sells home-made empanadas outside of her store.  She already has a customer base, and her business is prospering.  

Emiliana's children have already finished high school, and they are planning to continue their studies so that they can help their mother.  This is why Emiliana is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her store and empanadas.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store and empanadas

loans.name: Le Citadin Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Luneno est une commerçante d’une expérience de 17 ans, âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, qui tous  étudient. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Le Citadin». Elle est vendeuse divers souliers usagés dames. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 200 paires de souliers dames. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un agent dans une banque de la place. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de poste conflist dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Luneno, is a merchant with 17 years of experience. She is 37 years old and a married mother of six children, who are all students. This client is a member of a business collective “Le Citadin”. She is vendor of a variety of used women’s shoes. She sets up her merchandise at the town’s central market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 200 pairs of women’s shoes. She started off her business with funds from her husband. Her husband is a representative at a local bank. 

For the future, she wishes to build a nice house and provide education and food for her children. She thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them microloans during this post-conflict period in the country’s east.

loans.use: to purchase 200 pairs of women's shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beans, corn, firewood, cheese and flour.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, age 33, is employed as a garment worker. She lives in the province of Kampong Speu with her husband and their two children. Her husband, age 42, is a construction worker. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day to support the family. The couple is pictured at their home.

Mom would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She will use her loan funds to make essential repairs to the house in which the family lives. This loan will help them live in better conditions.

Mom's goal is to build a stable where she can raise cows and pigs to earn additional income.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to the house in which her family lives

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns her living in livestock, raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Jenefer has been in her current line of work for eight years, and has taken out and repaid two prior loans from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Richard Nixon

texts.es:
Richard, desde que era un niño aprendió a trabajar y a hacer todo lo posible para salir adelante y tener una vida digna.
Todas estas enseñanzas se las agradece a su padre que siempre lo guio por un buen camino.
Hoy en día, Richard tiene un negocio de venta de madera que alterna al mismo tiempo con una salsamentaría de su propiedad en el municipio de Tierra Alta, Córdoba, negocios que atiende todos los días con la ilusión de impulsarlos y posicionarlos en el mercado regional.
El se levanta desde muy temprano en la mañana para iniciar con sus actividades, las mismas que le han permitido sostener a su esposa y a sus 4 hijos ya que estas son las únicas fuentes de ingresos para su hogar.
Tiene la esperanza d obtener un crédito para realizar algunas adecuaciones al local donde tiene la salsamentaría y también para realizar la compra de surtido para el mismo.
El préstamo le permitirá continuar con su actividad y seguir demostrando su gran capacidad para superarse.
texts.en:
Ever since he was a boy, Richard was learning to work and to do everything possible to get ahead and to have a decent life.  He is grateful to his father for all of these teachings.  His father always guided him down the right path.  Nowadays Richard has a business of selling wood.  He alternates his time between this and a deli that he has in the Tierra Alta municipality in Córdoba.  He tends to the businesses every day because he wishes to move them into a position in the regional market.

He gets up very early in the morning in order to start his business activities.  These activities have allowed him to support his wife and their four children.  These are the only sources of income for his household.

He hopes to get a loan to make some adjustments to the place where he has the deli.  He will also buy stock for the deli.  The loan will allow him to continue his business activity.  It will also allow him to demonstrate his great capacity for improving himself.

loans.use: to make adjustments to his deli and to buy stock for it.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie farms sugarcane to earn her living. She has been engaged in this agricultural activity for four years. She works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Her goal is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eteline

texts.en: Eteline is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells chicken pies and meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Eteline needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pot, trays, paper plates, salt, soya sauce and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Eteline has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pot, trays, paper plates, salt, soya sauce and a new oven

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, age 35, fattens pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this agricultural business for 16 years, and she also earns additional income from running a general store.

She and her husband have three children.

Josie is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase an additional piglet as well as to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a piglet as well as to buy feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Kristel May is 18 years old and is the third of four children in the family. Her mother Miriam is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and is borrowing PHP 7,697 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Kristel May for the 1st semester, 2014-2015. She is currently in her 3rd of four years, working toward a Bachelor of Science degree in computer science.  When she graduates, Kristel May plans to to finish her studies and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 43, farms sugarcane to earn an income. She has been engaged in this agricultural business for 12 years, and she also earns additional income from running a general store.

She and her husband have two children.

Josephine is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and he is a private employee, too. Sultan lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Sultan is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Sultan began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Phally is 54 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is dependent. 

The primary sources of her family’s income are from growing cassava and rice. She has been in this business for 14 years. The current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day. To supplement the income, her husband works as a paid worker. 

Phally has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is applying for a new loan. 

As the leader of her group, Phally wants to use her portion of the loan to buy school materials to support her child’s education. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy home appliances for use in her household. Phally hopes to have enough school supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy school materials to support her child’s education.

loans.name: Paese

texts.en:
Paese is a 52-year-old woman who is unwed, with six children. She has a small sewing business to earn a living; she has four years of experience with this business. 

Paese needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric, measuring tape, scissors and a small table. 

She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Paese joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric, measuring tape, scissors and a small table

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio es un hombre trabajador, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Tiene dos maravillosos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha incansablemente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, se dedica al cultivo de cacao y le va muy bien puesto que es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por su puesto siempre ofrece productos de calidad a sus clientes.
Remigio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes para abono de sus cultivos y así pueda tener mayores ingresos con las ventas. Gracias a esto podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder cumplir más adelante su gran sueño: "Ver a sus hijos convertirse en grandes profesionales".
texts.en:
Remigio, age 46, is a hardworking man.  He is married and lives in Yarinacocha with his family.  He has two marvelous children, who are his greatest pride.  He struggles for them tirelessly in order to be able to give them a better future.

He has worked in agriculture for over eight years.  He grows cacao, and it is going very well for him.  This is because he is a very responsible, hardworking, and innovative person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Of course, he always offers quality products to his customers.

Remigio is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have given him, he will be able to buy supplies likes fertilizers to fertilize his crops.  This way he will be able to get greater income with his sales.  Thanks to this he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.  He will be able to fulfill his biggest dream, seeing his children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: John Paul is 16 years old and studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in civil engineering. He is currently on the first of a five-year program. Susan is a member of Project Dungganon and barrowing PHP 7,603 to pay for tuition fees of her son John Paul for the first semester, 2014-2015.  When he graduates, John Paul plans to work to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Marvin is 18 years old and is the second of nine children in the family.

His mother Imelda is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and her son will enroll in a Bachelor of Science in Criminology course. Imelda is borrowing PHP 9,695 to fully pay the tuition fees of her son Marvin for the three years' skills training. When he graduates, Marvin plans to help his family with their needs.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, age 50, farms sugarcane to earn her living. She has been engaged in this agricultural business for nine years. She lives with her husband and their three children, all of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Letecia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Oswaldo Enrique

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un campesino con mucha experiencia en el manejo y tratamiento del campo. Es humilde y sencillo, tiene una gran actitud de servicio y energía suficiente para poner cualquier cultivo a producir.
El tiene un cultivo de plátano en el municipio de Valencia el cual trabaja todos los días para obtener unas muy buenas cosechas y luego poder venderlas en el mercado del municipio.
Gracias a sus años de experiencia tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y salir adelante.
El solicita un auxilio para comprar insumos agrícolas y de esta manera inyectar capital a su actividad. 
Tiene muchas esperanzas e ilusiones depositadas en su negocio, por eso trata siempre de dar el máximo para sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a farmer with a lot of experience in farm management and treatment. He is humble and modest, he has an excellent attitude of service and enough energy to make any plantation grow. 
He has a banana plantation in Valencia, a township, where he works every day to obtain very good crops, in order to then sell them at the local market. 
Thanks to his years of experience, he is fully capable of working and moving forward. 
He is asking for help to buy some agricultural products, so that he might inject capital into his business.  
He has high hopes and dreams invested in his business, which is why he always tries to do his best to make it move forward.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Reizza Mae is 16 years old and is the first of six children in the family. Her mother Christine is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and supports the family through her frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

Reizza Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Christine is borrowing 10,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Reizza Mae for the first semester of 2014-2015. When she graduates, Reizza Mae plans to work at the hotel and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Evagalia

texts.en: Evagalia is a 36-year-old, married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Evagalia needs a loan to buy bags of sugar and flour, yeast, a frying pan, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Evagalia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, yeast, bags of flour, a frying pan, etc

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en: Bunthoeun is 24. He is a student who lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, he would like to apply for a loan of $275 to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him get a higher education. In the future, Bunthoeun hopes that he will get a good job. We took his photo while he was studying in his class.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy, 20 years old, is a third-year student in the Accounting Institute in Phnom Penh. Navy is a student who comes from the District of Kracheh Province of Cambodia. Her parents are farmers who grow cassavas and sell to local dealers. The financial support that she gets from her family is enough to pay only for her daily expenditures. Now she is lacking money to pay for the tuition fees. 

This near-future accountant is applying for a loan from Kiva now to pay for her tuition fees. She promises that she will repay the loan with the interest back to HKL on time, based on the repayment schedule. 

Navy would like to thank all lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Juana Celia

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer luchadora, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que salir adelante sola, pero eso no fue impedimento para que ella sobresaliera y y sacara a su familia adelante.
Desde hace casi dos años tiene un pequeño negocio, una bodega en la que ofrece diversidad de productos y con los ingresos obtenidos apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Le va muy bien porque desde muy joven ha luchado por el bienestar de su familia.
Juana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio, de esta manera ofrecerá productos variados a sus clientes y sus ventas mejorarán. Así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Juana is a fighter; she is 48 years old, single, and lives in Ica with her family. 
As a single mother, she had to go on alone; however, this has not stopped her from excelling and getting ahead with her family. 
For almost the last two years, she has had a store, a small shop where she offers many diverse products. She supports her parents with the household expenses using the income from the shop. She is successful because she has fought for the well-being of her family from a very young age. 
Juana is grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has enabled her to buy merchandise to stock her shop. This way, she can offer varied products to her customers, and her sales will improve. She can therefore improve her family´s quality of life and will continue to work hard to get her son ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her shop

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is from Moncada, Tarlac. She is 40 years old and married with children. One of her children, Jerome, is taking up the study of Computer Programming but she don't have enough money to pay her son's tuition. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders.  Currently, her family is struggling financially therefore, if this loan is granted, they will be very grateful.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is 41 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Nelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 34 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including snack foods, canned goods, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and detergent. She has been in her current line of work for 13 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Noami

texts.en: Noami works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Noami has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells pancakes and ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Faatupu needs a loan to buy a frying pan, oil, sugar, yeast and other goods. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Faatupu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, oil, sugar and a sack of flour

loans.name: Felicito

texts.en: Felicito from Ramos, Tarlac is 49 years old and married. His daughter Trixie is 15 years old and is taking up Computer Programming. Trixie wants to finish her studies so she can work in offices and companies. Their family’s income from their sari-sari store is sometimes not enough for them. Thus, Felicito wants a loan of PHP 10, 000 from Kiva lenders thru ASKI. Trixie is a hardworking student. According to her, she is doing her best in school for she has this dream of acquiring a profitable job to give her parents what they want.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees for his daughter

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and has four children. Arlene is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this activity.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 61 years old and married with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a sugarcane farm in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Rebecca has been in her current line of work for four years, and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and has eight children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

She is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elvie requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks for her pigs. Elvie has been fattening pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Resie

texts.en: Resie is 47 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening, in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Resie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 59 years old and married and he works very hard to provide for them.

He runs a general store in the Philippines. Romulo has been in this business for 50 years and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, cream, etc.

In the future Romulo would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, age 38, is the leader of this group of borrowers. She farms rice, cassava, and corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this agricultural activity for eight years and currently earns about 60,000 KHR per day. She lives in a rural village in the Kam Reang district of Battambang province with her husband and their four children, three of whom are dependents and still attending school. 
 
She is in her first cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy school materials in order to support her children’s education. 

Her goal is to ensure that her children have adequate school materials for their studies.

loans.use: to buy school materials in order to support her children’s education

loans.name: Nhers' Group

texts.en: Nhers is age 35 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, and she has three children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting corn for 13 years. The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day.  Nhers has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy school supplies for her children’s education, and to use a portion of it to spend on buying a home appliance for her family. She hopes her children will have enough school supplies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children’s education.

loans.name: Sochat's Group

texts.en: Sochat is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Kam Rieng district. One of her children is still in school, and she earns a living as a farmer, growing corn and cassava. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is her family's main source of income. She also supplements her income by working for other people for a salary. She currently earns about KHR 30,000 a day and is able to save 10,000 each day. Sochat has been with VisionFund for one prior loan cycle, and now leads a two-person group which is seeking a new loan. She wants to use her portion of this loan to buy school supplies for her child’s education. Her goal is to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her child’s education

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 24 years old and married with three children. Daniel is asking for a loan so that he can purchase what he needs in his farm like fertilizer, seed and pesticide. Daniel is a very kind person; he always considers the needs of his children. According to him, with his young children, he wants to save enough money for his family so that he can build his own house.

loans.use: he purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide.

loans.name: Aminata Kai

texts.en: Aminata is 52 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are 33, 28, and 23 years old. In 2012, Aminata established a cosmetics business, selling mainly soap, cream, Vaseline and body spray. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living and increase her profits. Working seven days a week and sixteen hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 a month. She would like a loan for Le 4,000,000 to buy more soap, cream, Vaseline and body spray to sell to her customers. This business has helped her raise her children. She is looking forward to receiving her loan because it will help her develop her business and save enough money for retirement. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cream and Vaseline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university tuition and buy materials for his practicums.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en: Anecito is a businessman from Oroquieta. He runs a little retail store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. Anecito is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. He has now applied for a loan to restock trays of eggs for retail. He continues to have energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock trays of eggs for retail

loans.name: Telma Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Telma se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas, además tiene una venta de frutas en el mercado municipal, es madre de dos niños y por ellos es que junto a su esposo están luchando para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y por ello es que ha solicitado su crédito para invertir más y así obtener ganancias, tiene buen record crediticio. Agradece desde ya el apoyo que le brindaran y se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza.
texts.en: Telma raises chickens and also sells fruit in the local market.  She is the mother of two and she and her husband are striving to provide the best for their children and she is asking for a loan to invest into her business and increase her profits.  She has a good credit record, appreciates the support, and is committed to being responsible with her payments.  She is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 10 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida trabajando como cosmetóloga en un salón  de belleza. Es así como  contribuye con la economía familiar. Junto a su esposo  quien es comerciante de dulces mantienen la economía del hogar. Antonia desea construir un muro perimetral para dar una mayor seguridad a su familia y a sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, hierro, grava y pagar mano de obra para la construcción del muro.
texts.en:
Antonia is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 10-year-old daughter. She makes a living as a cosmetologist in a beauty salon, and this helps contribute to the family's budget. Along with her husband, who is a candy salesman, they are able to cover the household expenses.

Antonia would like to construct a wall around their house in order to provide added security for her family and their few possessions. That's why she's asked for this loan from FUSAI (Kiva Field Partner) to buy bricks, cement, iron and gravel, and pay for construction of the wall.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, iron and gravel, and pay for construction of a wall around her house.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 58 years old and married, with five children. 

Nila is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Nila has been farming rice for nine years now and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Nila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 10 years, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a 29-year-old married woman, with three children, two of whom are attending school. She is a palm oil seller, working for 11 hours, seven days a week.  She has been in this business since 2013, and also has additional income from farming. She wants the money to buy palm oil to sell, and hopes to expand her business in the future. Eliza is a hardworking person, however, she complains of competition and limited capital that affects her profit margins.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Ariadne Del Socorro

texts.es:
La familia es uno de los principales motores para cualquier persona, en especial, para los jóvenes cuando están emprendiendo a un mejor futuro. Este es el caso de Ariadne, una joven de 24 años, quien se ha entregado a sus estudios hasta llegar a convertirse en Licenciada en Diplomacia y Relaciones Internacionales. Tras conseguir un trabajo, acorde a su carrera, sintió que ella podía dar más de sí misma, entonces decidió hace cuatro años, tomar la iniciativa de empezar su propio negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, gaseosa, entre otros, del negocio que ha ido de tradición desde su abuelo. 
Ariedne siempre ha sido caracterizada por tener un plan de vida, por lo que considera, a pesar de no tener otros ingresos, seguir creciendo. Es por esto, necesita de un préstamo para comprar más productos de venta como, ropa, sandalias, bolsos, huevos y gaseosa, de manera que pueda ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes y sus ingresos incrementen. Entre los planes principales de Ariedne están: ampliar el negocio y poner una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Family is one on the main drivers for anyone, especially young people when they are embarking on a better future. This is the case with Ariadne, a young woman aged 24, who dedicated herself to her studies until graduating in diplomacy and international relations. After getting a job in keeping with her degree, she felt that she could do better for herself. Therefore, four years ago, she took the initiative to start her own business selling clothing, shoes, fizzy drinks, and other items from the shop that has been in her family since her grandfather bought it.

Ariedne has always had a life plan, which is why she intends, despite having no other income, to continue growing. This is why she needs a loan to buy more products to sell, such as clothing, sandals, bags, eggs and fizzy drinks, so that she can offer more goods to her customers and boost her profits. Ariadne's main plans include expanding the business and hiring a salesperson.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as clothing, sandals, bags, eggs and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables and food products.

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es: Doña Josefa es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha trabajado en su negocio desde hace 10 años, la socia se dedica  a vender nacatamales. Cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano y de su esposo los cuales les ayudan económicamente y  además le ayudar a vender y a realizar las compras. Josefa  planea invertir el crédito en la compra de materia prima  como papas, carne de cerdo, tomate, hierba buena, hojas de chaguites, mecates, arroz, leña etc . Con los créditos que ha obtenido la socia ha logrado mantener su negocio  y  aumentar sus ventas con la produccion de los nacatamales.
texts.en: Doña Josefa is a strong and entrepreneurial woman who has worked in her business for the past ten years.  She is a member dedicated to making nacatamales (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf).  She counts on assistance from her brother and her husband who help her economically and also help her to sell and to make purchases.  Josefa is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials like potatoes, pork, tomatoes, and hierba buena (mint), rice, rope, charcoal, etc . With the loans she has obtained previously she has been able to maintain her business and grow her sales with the production of nacatamales.

loans.use: To purchase food products like potatoes, pork, tomatoes, and mint.

loans.name: Janat's Group

texts.en:
Janat's Group is comprised of three hardworking women. Janat is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past six months, Janat has been working hard to manage her small business of selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new shirts and trousers to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay rent for her workplace. Janat hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Janat is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new shirts, and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 39 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer in a place where he can get all the needs of his family. 

Rolly is asking for a loan amounting to 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for his business. Rolly hopes that his business will expand so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for his business.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Margaret Salome runs a general store business to earn a living. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising livestock. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

Margaret Salome and her husband have four children, and she works hard to support her family.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now hoping to receive a new loan to further build her general store business. She has requested PhP 40,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale in her general store.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Porcelie

texts.en:
Timmy Jr. is 20 years old and is the second of six children in the family. His mother Porcelie, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

Timmy Jr. is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the first of this four year course.

Porcelie, Timmy Jr.'s mother, is borrowing PHP 7,285 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15. Timmy Jr. plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia's group is comprised of two hard-working young women. Sylivia, age 20, sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for one year. She lives in the town of Iganga.

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan in the amount of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to offer for sale, and will help Sylivia to generate greater profits, which will in turn allow her to to cover her family's needs. 

Sylivia hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoalto offer  for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 21 years old, and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her market stall, where she sells raw bananas. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of fresh food to sell.  It will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child when the need arises. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more sacks of fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Veronica De Jesus

texts.es: Verónica de 43 años de edad vive con su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de marcos para foto y diplomas desde hace vario años trabaja en su lugar de residencia y luego sale a comercializarlos en las diferentes colonias de la zona con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su hijo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Veronica solicita un crédito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboración de los marcos como: revistas, láminas, bobinas de plástico, etc. para seguir teniendo buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Veronica is 43 years old and lives with her son.  She has had a business for several years selling frames for photographs and diplomas.  She works from her home, and then goes out to sell the frames in different neighborhoods in her area.  With the income that she earns from her sales, and with help from her son, she is able to cover her household expenses.  Veronica is requesting a loan to be able to buy the things that she needs to make her frames, such as magazines, sheet metal, and spools of plastic, etc., in order to continue earning a good income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy magazines, sheet metal, and spools of plastic, etc.,

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past one year, Olivia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for her business, and will help Olivia to generate greater profits and pay for rent of the shop. Olivia hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a landlady by owning rental houses. 

Olivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es: Blanca de 36 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos dos niños de doce y nueve años y una niña de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de lociones por catalogo de forma ambulante para apoyar a su familia  en los gastos del hogar. Blanca desea encementar el piso ya que es de tierra y repellar las paredes de su casa que son de adobe pues estas son un foco de anidación de plagas por lo que resulta insalubre  para su familia, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y grava para realizar las mejoras lo antes posible en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 36, lives with her common-law husband and their three children, two boys, 12 and nine years old, and a girl, four.  Blanca is a very enterprising woman who works as a street vendor selling lotions by catalogue to support her family with household expenses.

Blanca wants to put down a cement floor because the one in her house is a dirt floor.  She also wants to put up drywall in her adobe house to avoid insect infestation which is unhealthy for the family.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to carry out these home improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel for a cement floor and to put up drywall in her house.

loans.name: Leopoldina Ambrosia
