texts.es: Leopoldina Ambrosía 57 años de edad casada con cinco hijos de los cuales dos están aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se Caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, responsable en todos sus compromisos, y con muchos deseos de superación tanto personal como laboral, Leopoldina es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces de leche como:cajetas de leche y coco, bollitos de leche en vasos y envueltos en plástico, entre otros, los que elabora diariamente en su casa y sale a entregar a comerciantes detallistas como: pulperias, comidieras, farmacias, escuelas entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado y sus ventas son al contado a clientes fijos y eventuales, Leopoldina Inicia su negocio hace mas de 30 años por la necesidad de criar alimentar y cuidar a sus hijos, inicia con la venta de chicha de maíz(refresco en masa, con el obsequio de quince libras de maíz que recibió de un familiar y quien ademas le dio la idea de hacer negocios y como hacerlo con el tiempo llega a venderse mas de cien libras de chicha, iniciándose en este negocio es donde recibió la receta de como hacer dulces de leche trabajando actualmente en esta actividad en la cual los elabora con mucho gusto y cariño, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en le compra de insumo para la elaboración de dulces de leche como: leche, azúcar, coco, leña, bolsitas, vasos, arroz pallana, harina, canela entre otros.
texts.en:
Leopoldina Ambrosía is 57 years old, she is married and has five children of whom two still depend on her. She is a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is in the west of the country. She is known for being a fighter, responsible in all her commitments, and with a great desire to get ahead personally and in her job.

Leopoldina is a small business owner and works selling milk-based sweets, such as: coconut toffee, filled buns in cups and wrapped in plastic, and more. She prepares these every day in her home and then goes to deliver them to retail traders such as grocery stores, eateries, pharmacies, schools, and others. She sells for cash to permanent and temporary customers.

Leopoldina started her business more than 30 years ago, because she needed to raise, provide food for and take care of her children. She started by selling chicha (a soft drink made with corn masa) with the help of a gift of fifteen pounds of corn which she received from a relative. This relative also gave her the idea to set up a business, and he told her how to do it and how to sell more than one hundred pounds of chicha after some time. By starting the business, she also received the recipe for how to make milk-based sweets, and now this is her job which she does with enthusiasm and great care. 

One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business.

She wants to use the loan to invest it in working capital, which is to buy supplies to prepare the sweets, like: milk, sugar, coconut, wood, little bags, cups, broken rice, flour, cinnamon, and others.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her delicious milk-based sweets, like: broken rice, sugar, wood, flour, cinnamon, cups, little bags, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Bella

texts.es: Mirna de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando actualmente. Ellos se ganan la vida gracias a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda tales como:  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, sal, aceite, etc. Mirna desea reconstruir su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra bastante deteriorada para lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI con el que comprará cemento, arena,grava, ladrillo, y pagará mano de obra para la reconstrucción. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y de esta forma poder mejor sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Mirna is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and her children, who are 14 and 9 and are attending school.  She makes her living selling basic products such as rice, sugar, beans, salt,  cooking oil, etc., from her home.  Mirna would like to rebuild her house, because it is now in poor condition.  For this reason she is requesting a loan through FUSAI, to buy cement, sand, gravel, and bricks, and to pay for labor for the rebuilding.  She hopes to have access to this financing so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and bricks, and to pay for labor for the rebuilding of her house.

loans.name: Amistad Cusqueña Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de amigos y vecinos formaron el banco comunal “AMISTAD CUSQUEÑA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Maria tiene 42 años y se dedica a la venta de interiores como por ejemplo bóxer, calzoncillos, medias, calzones y otras, ella lleva sus productos a todos sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder abastecer de mas cosas. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de libros, servicio de transporte urbano, carpintería, maestro albañil, venta de ropa y brindando el servicio de taxi.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.(La socia Maria esta levantando la mano en la fotografía).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the "Amistad Cusqueña" [Cusqueño Friendship] communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

María is 42 years old and earns her living selling undergarments like boxers, briefs, socks, women's underwear, and more. She takes her products to the city of Cuzco and sells them in the various street markets. She has worked in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. At this point, she needs the loan to buy merchandise so she can stock up with more items.

The other members earn their livings with a book sales business, a public transportation service, carpentry, master masonry, a clothing sales business, and a taxi service.

María is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline. (María is raising her hand in the photograph.)

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to stock up with more items

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Cristina; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de gasoesas,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, a la vez la socia continua trabajando como docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cristina is the member.  She continues with her business of buying and selling soft drinks.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  She gets financial as well as personal satisfaction from this business.  She also continues working as a teacher at one of the schools in the area.

She is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks for her business.  She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Yoneda

texts.en:
Yoneda, 35 years old, is a female. She is single with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She operates a produce business, concentrating on beans and maize. She has been in that business since 2004. 

Yoneda began the business to support her children, after separating from her husband. She is working hard to achieve her goal of expanding her business and educating her children to university level. However, she is faced with a challenge of seasonal changes, especially the floods that affect her area. 

Yoneda intends to use a loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a Ugandan woman, living in Masindi. She sells clothes in a boutique to both women and men. She wants a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business and to educate her children. However, she faces a challenge of change in designs, whereby she usually loses out on old stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María es una señora casada, de 56 años que siempre ha tenido que valerse por sí misma, ya que sus cinco hijos de las edades entre 23-35 años se convirtieron independientes. Anteriormente, era dueña de un bar, donde la asaltaron una vez, por lo que decidió remplazarlo por la venta de productos naturales, desde hace cuatro años. Además, la bachiller, tras haber sufrido un bajón por su salud física, nunca dejó el sueño de seguir creciendo económicamente. Bluefields y Managua, son los principales puntos de ventas, sin embargo, quiere llegar a más personas y ser conocida a nivel nacional. 
María no tiene otro ingreso para seguir sosteniendo sus ventas, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para comprar más productos naturales y así ofrecerles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Afortunadamente, por aparte vende cosméticos y ropa usada, lo que le permite avanzar con el pago de este futuro préstamo.  Sus metas están más que fijadas, pues desea ampliar su negocio, mejorar las condiciones y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ya que solo esto le ayudará a expandirlo.
texts.en:
María is a married woman aged 56, who has always had to fend for herself since her five children, aged between 23 and 25 became independent. Previously, she owned a bar, but she was assaulted, and so decided to sell up and move into selling natural products four years ago. 

In addition, after suffering ill health, she never stopped dreaming of growing economically. Bluefields and Managua are her main points of sale, however, she would like to reach more customers and become known nationally.

María has no other means of income to continue supporting her sales, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy more natural products, and in this way, offer better customer service. Fortunately, she also sells cosmetics and used clothing, which allows her to pay back this future loan. 

She has very clear goals; she wants to expand her business, improve conditions and continue investing in her business, as only this will help her grow it.

loans.use: to buy more natural products.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, es una madre soltera.  Ella solo logro estudiar hasta 7º grado ya que sus padres ya no tenían la capacidad para seguir pagando sus estudios; actualmente vive sola junto a su hijo de 11 años que está haciendo 8º grado en la escuela. 

María se ha dedicado a vender  productos de la canasta básica, para satisfacer a los habitantes de la comunidad, también vende pupusas tres días a la semana esta actividad la aprendió cuando trabajaba para una señora que contrataba sus servicios  le ayudaba a hacer pupusas en el mercado del pueblo, luego ella decidió poner su propia venta en el patio de su casa y le dio buenos resultados y desde entonces realiza las dos actividades.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una plancha industrial para tener más espacio para hacer más pupusas, además la que tiene actualmente está muy dañada y la otra parte del crédito será invertida en la compra estantes para colocar los productos que tiene a la venta en su tienda y además comprar más mercadería para vender.

La señora tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, comprar más productos para vender tener su plancha; además tiene un gran sueño en la vida el de ayudar a su hijo a que realice sus estudios y que sea un profesional y sabe que con la ayuda del crédito lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and is a single mother. She was only able to study up to the 7th grade as her parents didn't have the capacity to keep paying for her studies. She currently lives alone with her 11-year-old son who is in the 8th grade at school. 

María has made a living by selling products of basic need to satisfy the needs of community residents. She also sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) three days a week. She learned this business when she was working for a lady who contracted her services; María helped the lady make pupusas in the market in town and then she decided to sell her own on the patio of her house. It went well and since then she has done both activities.

The loan she is asking for is to buy an industrial griddle to have more space to make pupusas; the one she has currently is very damaged. The other part of the loan will be invested in buying shelves on which to put the products she sells in her store as well as buying more merchandise to sell.

María has planned to expand her business, to buy more products to sell and to get her griddle. She also has a great dream in life, to help her son study and become a professional, and she knows that she will be able to achieve this with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle to have more space to make pupusas, to buy shelves on which to put the products she sells in her store, and to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells bags. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of bags to sell, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and add another business of selling clothes. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her parent’s house. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy different types of bags to sell.

loans.name: Shilly

texts.en:
Shilly is 20 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Shilly has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Shilly has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Shilly to generate greater profits and open up another business around town. Shilly hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a retail shop. 

Shilly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alberto Eudomar

texts.es:
Alberto es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Pucusana junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja como comprador en una empresa de transporte y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajador, respetuoso y amable con los clientes.
Alberto está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar el cuarto que le cedió su madre como pintarrajear las paredes, para que de esta manera pueda vivir de manera más cómoda y pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder lograr una de sus mayores metas: Comprarse un carro y ser un gran empresario
texts.en:
Alberto is an enterprising young man. He is nineteen years old, single, and lives in Pucusana with his family. He is a very driven person and eager to get ahead, which is why he always does his very best in order to provide for his family. For the past two years he has been working as a buyer for a transportation company and things are going very well for him because he is very responsible, hardworking, respectful, and nice to the customers.

Alberto is grateful to Kiva lenders because their support will allow him to remodel the room his mother let him have by painting the walls, etc. This way he will live more comfortably and his quality of life will improve. He plans to keep working hard in order to eventually achieve one of his main goals, which is to buy a car and become a great business man.

loans.use: to fix a room.

loans.name: Luz Rocio

texts.es:
Luz Rocío tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una bodega la cual vende productos de primera necesidad y materiales de construcción, desde hace 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, yeso, calamina para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Luz Rocío is 21 years old. She lives with her children and husband in the district of Oyotun, a community engaged in farming, commerce and raising livestock, located in the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the Northern coast of Peru. For 2 years, she and her husband have had a grocery store where they sell basic need items and building materials. Her business is located in her house. She has requested a loan of 3000 new soles to Edpyme Alternativa to buy building materials such as cement, plaster and corrugated iron in order to stock up her store, and in this way offer these products to her customers, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy building materials to stock up her business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia, age 18, sells charcoal to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to offer for sale, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits, which in turn will allow her to pay rent for her working place at the market. 

Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a market stall that sells fresh food. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 51 years old and married to a farmer. They have two grown children. She is operating a small store for additional income. She wants to sell more goods, but she has insufficient funds. She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, biscuits, sugar, soap, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to keep offering good products and services so she will improve sales capacity and be able to acquire good profits, which she will use for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, sugar, soap, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Elizabeht

texts.es:
María Elizabeht tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, gallinas, patos y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos que le permitan mejorar la producción de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Elizabeht is 52 years old and lives with her husband and son in their home in a big community in the urban area of Zaña, which is located in the Chiclayo Province within the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Perú. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. 

She raises and sells small animals such as turkeys, chickens, ducks and pigs in her backyard. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten up the animals which will allow them to improve their livestock production and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up her livestock.

loans.name: Hilber Ivan

texts.es:
Hilber Ivan tiene 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos 11,8 y 4 de edad, en casa propia de material rustico, en una comunidad pequeña en el Caserío El Roble, una zona rural del Distrito Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de animales menores (patos, gallinas cuyes), las que cría en el corral ubicado en su domicilio, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno tiene una vaca y un becerro; cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Hilber Ivan is 30 years old and lives with his spouse and their 3 minor children aged 4, 8 and 11 years old. They live in their own house made of rustic materials in the village of El Roble, This is in a rural area of Santo Tomas District, located in Cutervo Province, which belongs to Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

He works raising and selling small animals (chickens, ducks and guinea pigs). He raises them in a pen located at his residence. He also raises cattle, having a cow and calf. Hilber Ivan says that he has a lot of experience in this field. He has requested a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals to fatten them and offer them to his clients at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their van. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her van.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: María, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene con su esposo un hijo con quien vive en una aldea de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Lleva dos años de haber decidido por tener una fuente de ingresos para la manutención familiar. Tiene una pulpería donde vende azúcar, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, café, refrescos, churros, granos básicos lácteos, pan, jugos, huevos etc. Con el fin de surtir el negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para mantener surtida la pulpería  de productos comestibles básicos y poder generar ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer grande su negocio para darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and a son in a neighborhood in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Two years ago, she decided to have a source of income in order to sustain her family. She has a store where she sells sugar, rice, beans, flour, lard, coffee, soft drinks, snack foods, basic grains, dairy products, bread, juices, eggs, and other items. With the intent of restocking her business and offering a variety of products, María is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL. She will be able to maintain her inventory of basic food products and generate income.

Her goal is to enlarge her business so that she can provide a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products so that she can restock her store.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, age 23, sells basic commodities in her general store to earn an income. She has been working hard in this business since she started it up three years ago. She lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. 
 
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Justine to generate greater profits. With her expanded profits, she hopes eventually to turn her small retail business into a wholesale shop. 

Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and other basic commodities to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Sharifa's Group

texts.en:
Sharifa's Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sharifa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past one year, Sharifa has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where he sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Sharifa has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Sharifa to generate greater profits and to buy basic needs for her family. Sharifa hopes that in the future, she will be able to transform the business into a restaurant. 

Sharifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for her business.

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Lares Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE LARES, el banco está ubicado el distrito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, restraurante, hospedaje, crianza de animales menores.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por  motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen Natividad de Lares” is located in the District of Lares in Calca Province, which is in the Department of Cusco.  

One of the members is 32 years old, single, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business.  She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work.  She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  

This member is requesting a loan in order to buy rice and other products.  She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.  The other group members work in agriculture, manage a restaurant, manage a hotel, and raise small animals.


The group members that are in the attached photo were given permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work obligations.

loans.use: to buy rice and other products.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is dedicated to the cultivation of agricultural products. She is married, and she earns her per cropping. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of improved seeds to maintain her income. She is a very responsible woman, and for this reason she is requesting help.

In the future, Novelyn hopes that she can renovate her house to have better living.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farm business

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
{Note to the editor: Anh requires a loan for the same objects as before because these are the inputs that are required to further grow her business}

Anh is requesting a new loan to buy more sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials in order to further expand her business. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to pay for the tuition fees, books, uniforms, board and lodging for his daughter, Jenny Rose. Jenny Rose is studying at Isabela State University taking up a BS in Education. Their source of income is farming of rice and corn. Her parents’ income is just enough for their daily expenditures and agricultural businesses. They are working hard to finish the education of Jenny Rose, that’s why she is studying hard so that after she graduates, she can help her parents financially.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees, books, uniforms, board and lodging for his daughter, Jenny Rose.

loans.name: Omar Andres

texts.es:
Omar, de 46 años, recorre por los establecimientos del mercado oriental, mientras camina, va observando los anillos, los collares o algunos aretes que usan las personas que caminan junto a él, pues siempre busca alguna inspiración para crear una nueva joya. Desde hace tres años, es comerciante y elaborador de joyas en el mercado, como todo trabajo digno que para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar y la inversión educativa de sus tres hijos de las edades de 23, 13 y 12 años.  
Afortunadamente Omar terminó su universidad, pues eso lo inspiró a seguir adelante y construir su propio negocio. A los 28 años inició con el poco dinero que tenia ahorrado y poco a poco, fue invirtiendo en materiales y producción para ir creciendo. No obstante no tiene apoyo de nadie más, es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en la mercadería, comprar cadenas, plata, oro, pinzas, aros de metal, entre otros materiales para construir sus obras de arte. Su sueño siempre ha sido adquirir su propio local, extenderse a otros mercados, empezando con su propio modulo y así seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Omar is 46 years old.  He travels around through businesses in the eastern market, and as he does he observes the rings, necklaces and earrings that people walking around him are wearing.  He does this because he is always looking for inspiration to create a new piece of jewelry.  He has been making and selling jewelry in the market for three years, as a way to pay his household expenses and invest in the education of his three children, who are 23, 13 and 12.  Omar was fortunate to be able to complete university, and this inspired him to create his own business.  He started out at age 28, with a bit of money that he had saved, and little by little invested in materials and production in order to grow the business.  He has no support from anyone else, and would like to continue investing in merchandise, and to buy chains, silver, gold, tongs, metal rings, and other materials to make his works of art.  His dream has always been to have his own store, to expand to different markets and to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy chains, silver, gold, tongs, metal rings, and other materials.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es: Juana de 27 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella logra salir adelante gracias a la venta de productos básicos que realiza en su vivienda tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. Juana es una mujer tan emprendedora que además de la venta que realiza en su vivienda también vende productos por catalogo de forma domiciliar, esto le permite tener mejores ingresos. Ella desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en mal estado, lo que provoca un ambiente de inseguridad a su familia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y pagar mano de obra para el cambio de techo de su  vivienda.
texts.en: Juana is 27 years old.  She lives with her life partner and her two-year-old daughter.  She has been able to get ahead thanks to her business selling basic products such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc., from her home.  Juan is such an enterprising woman that in addition to her sales from home she also sells products from a catalogue to people in their homes, in order to earn more income.  She would like to replace the roof of her house, which is in poor condition, and which has created an environment of insecurity for her family.  For this reason she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal and nails, and to pay for labor, in order to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and nails, and to pay for labor, in order to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to finish the construction of a room in her home.

loans.name: Sergio Luis

texts.es:
Sergio es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo que caracteriza a los campesinos de Colombia. 
Sergio, no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar una tienda para complementar su actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estarse quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente.
Es por esta razón que el señor Sergio solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que distribuye y que incluso vende lo que cultiva en su tierra, adicionalmente desea comprar insumos agropecuarios para mantener sus cultivos sanos y sus tierras en perfectas condiciones. 
Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para continuar sosteniendo a su familia y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Sergio is a farmer who was born and raised with values such as humility and hard work that characterizes the rural laborers of Colombia.

Sergio, not satisfied with the income he earned in farming, decided to open a store to complement his farming which has been slow for a long time. If there is anything that characterizes a farmer, it's that they cannot rest and they are constantly working.

For this reason, Sergio is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of staple goods and groceries, sweets, and snacks for his store which are very well-known products. He will even sell what they grow on their land. He additionally wishes to purchase agricultural inputs to maintain healthy crops and keep his land in ideal conditions.

His dream is that God will allow him to be healthy and work tirelessly to generate a good income to continue supporting and raising his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his store and purchase agricultural inputs for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hajira's Group

texts.en:
Hajira's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Hajira is 22 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Hajira has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hajira has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shirts and trousers for sale, and will help Hajira to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Hajira hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling second-hand clothes. 

Hajira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and trousers for sale

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Noemí de 32 años de edad es separada con 01 hija dependiente. Ella es parte del grupo “Madres Unidas” y está conformado por 06 socios emprendedores y responsables. Noemí se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir hace más de 03 años en la casa de sus padres. Noemí tiene el anhelo de contar son su propio local y continuar creciendo en su negocio. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de telas, hilos y botones. El grupo “Madres Unidas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Noemí se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en: Noemi is 32 years old and is separated, with one dependent daughter.  She is part of the "Madres Unidas" group, which is made up of 6 enterprising and responsible members.  Noemi has worked for more than 3 years making clothing from her parents' house.  Noemi dreams of having her own shop, and continuing to grow her business.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, thread and buttons.  The "Madres Unidas" group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that they provide.  In the photo, Noemi is seen standing in the back row, wearing a blue short-sleeved shirt.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Katherin Valeria

texts.es: Katherin una atractiva mujer de 21 años de edad la cual se dedica a la comercialización de productos AMWAY, actividad que aprendió gracias a su madre con la que se iba e n las tardes a comercializar sus productos pero desde el año 2012 comenzó su vida como independiente vendiendo esta marca y haciendo conocer en el mercado. Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos de uso personal puesto que quiere hacerlos sobresalir en el mercado y que todo su pueblo se beneficie de estos y claro sin olvidar que todo esto lo hace por su hija de 1 año de edad por la cual trabaja y se trasnocha con tal de verle siempre reír
texts.en: Katherin is an attractive 21-year-old woman who works selling AMWAY brand products. She learned this business thanks to her mother, with whom she would go out in the afternoons to sell products. Then in 2012 she started out on her own selling this brand and making it known in the market. She is requesting this loan to buy personal products because she wants them to stand out in the market and for the whole town to benefit from them, keeping in mind that she does all of this for her one-year-old daughter, for whom she works and stays up late in order to see her laugh.

loans.use: to buy AMWAY brand personal products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over-sewing machine, and a table.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25-year-old single man from Bedya, a small village near Nablus city. Three years ago he started his own business, which is a stall for selling traditional food. It is a good business and located in a very good area. Abdallah would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy food he needs for his business. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

Abdallah appears in the photo while he is working

loans.use: to buy food he needs for his business

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene dos maravillosos hijos por quienes día a día lucha para poder brindarles un mejor futuro y mayores oportunidades.
Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, tiene experiencia en el cultivo de cacao, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, emprendedor, y sobre todo porque siempre brinda productos de calidad a los clientes.
Alvina está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes para poder abonar sus cultivos, de esta manera pueda obtener mejores productos y por lo tanto mayores ingresos. Así, ella seguirá esforzándose para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Alvina is a hardworking woman. She is 38 years old, married, and lives in San Martin with her family. She has two wonderful children for whom she fights every day in order to be able to give them a better future and more opportunities.

She has been a farmer for over eight years and has experience growing cacao. Things are going well for her because she is a very responsible and enterprising person and above all because she always gives her customers high quality products.

Alvina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because their support will allow her to buy supplies like fertilizer for her crops so that she can obtain a better product and, in turn, more income. She plans to keep doing her best to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Niyonyishu Ii Group

texts.fr:
Férdinand  fait partie du groupe Niyonyishu II et  habite à Gitega. Il a 34 ans et est marié  à  Francine,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot,…) depuis  7 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de riz et de haricot  à revendre dans sa boutique pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines,  il voudrait acheter de terres cultivables pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Férdinand is a member of the Niyonyishu II Group. He is 34 years old and married to Francine, a farmer. They live together in Gitega with their three children, one of which is currently receiving an education.

He has been selling items (rice, beans...) from his shop for the past seven years.

This is his fourth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he plans to increase his capital and purchase many kilos of rice and beans which he will resell at a profit in his shop.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase land for his children.

loans.use: to purchase many kilos of rice and beans which he will resell at a profit in his shop.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama, age 27, sells used electrical and electronic goods from his small store. He has operated his store for three years. He also helps his family plant and harvest seasonal crops on family-owned farmland. 

He lives with his wife in a small house in Attel, a small village near Tulkarm City. 

Osama requested a loan from FATEN in order to buy more used electrical and electronic goods to offer for sale in his store. This investment will improve the selection of items available in his store and will increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy used electrical and electronic goods to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an over-sewing machine.

loans.name: Kora-Nidukore Group

texts.fr:
Donavine  fait partie du groupe  Kora-nidukore  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 44 ans et est mariée à Stany, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 22 ans et qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  75 kilos de sucre, 5 caisses de bière industrielle et 2 caisses de limonade à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Donavine is a member of the Kora-Nidukore Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 44 years old and married to Stany, who is a teacher. They have had one child together, who is 22 years old and is currently studying. She has been running a shop for the past two years. This will be her first loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to increase her working capital and purchase 75 kilos of sugar, five crates of mass-produced beer and two crates of lemonade, which will be resold from her shop in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to increase their working capital and purchase 75 kilos of sugar, five crates of mass-produced beer and two crates of lemonade, which will be resold from their shop in order to earn more money

loans.name: Yesenia Isabel

texts.es: Yesenia de 28 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos  de 6 y 12 años y 6 meses de edad. Ella es muy tenaz y trabajadora se gana la vida con la venta de diversos platos típicos tales como: papas fritas, yuca frita, y sancochada, chilate, etc. su compañero de vida aporta gracias a su trabajo de fontanero. Yesenia desea reparar las paredes de su vivienda ya que las que tiene actualmente son de adobe lo que causa anidación de plagas, además desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda el cual esta muy dañado como se observa en la fotografía por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, y arena para reparar paredes y lámina y madera para cambiar el techo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 28 years old and lives with her partner and children aged 6, 12, and 6 months. She is very tenacious and hard-working, and makes a living selling various typical dishes such as fried chips, fried and boiled yucca, chilate, a corn-based drink, and others. Her partner contributes to their household through his work as a plumber.

Yesenia wants to repair the walls of her home as the current ones are adobe, which encourages pest to nest. She also wants to replace the roof of her home, which is very damaged, as you can see in the photograph. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement and sand to repair the walls, and sheeting and wood to replace the roof.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to repair the walls, and sheeting and wood to replace the roof.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 27-year-old, single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem City. 

Four years ago, Thaer started his own business, which is a store where he sells toys and gifts. He imports his products from outside Palestine, at very low prices, and he resells them. It is a good business.

Thaer took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new products for the Eid season to sell in his store. This will improve his store and increase its sales. 

Thaer appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy new products for his store.

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en:
Sumin is 18 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Sumin has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food like cassava and fresh bananas for sale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Sumin hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Sumin is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food like cassava and fresh bananas for sale,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an air-conditioner.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 30 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos dos niños de 12 años (gemelos) y una niña de 1 año de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como albañil, también pinta casas y es fontanero lo que le permite dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, su compañera de vida lo apoya económicamente con la venta de pan que realiza todos los días. Francisco desea poner el techo a su vivienda, también necesita comprar puertas y ventanas ya que como se observa en la fotografía su casa no cuenta con ellas y son necesarias para darle seguridad a su familia y a sus pocas pertenencias por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para colocar el techo y también comprará puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Francisco is thirty years old and lives with his life partner and their three children. Their twin boys are twelve years old and their daughter is one. He is an enterprising man who makes a living as a construction worker. He also paints houses and works as a plumber, which allows him to give his family better living conditions. His partner contributes financially by selling the bread she bakes daily. 

Francisco wants to build a roof for his house and also needs to buy doors and windows. As can be seen in the picture, his house doesn't have any and he needs them in order to provide safety for his family and their few belongings. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which he will use to buy sheet metal, purlins, and pins for the roof, as well as doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, purlins, and pins to build a roof, and also buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Thea is 37 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. The primary source of her family’s income is from weaving mats and her husband is a paid worker to earn additional income. She has been in this business for 17 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Thea has just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise and use some portion of it to spend on building a piggery. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income through this new business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a sewing machine, and fabric.

loans.name: Faris

texts.en:
Faris is a 23-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin called Qabatiya. Three years ago, Faris started his job as a construction worker. It is a good business but the income is not stable due to the demand. Faris would like to open his own business as a construction service office in the future.

Faris took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cement and wood bars for his construction business. This will help him to increase his productivity and also his income.

Faris appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cement and wood bars for his construction business.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Desde hace 20 años el señor Heriberto se dedica a la venta de legumbres y frutas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Itagüí, antes trabajaba como transportador de estos alimentos pero llego un momento en el que decidió establecerse con un negocio propio y aprovechando los contactos que había obtenido en este trabajo, pudo montar su propio puesto de venta y comenzar a ganar ingresos por su propia cuenta.
Es una persona muy capaz y su edad no le impide soñar e ilusionarse con un buen futuro para él y sus hijos, tanto así que sueña con heredarles el negocio y que estos continúen con él.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido al por mayor y poder abastecer su puesto de trabajo con variados productos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá garantizar la permanencia de su negocio.
texts.en:
Heriberto has been working selling fruits and vegetables for twenty years in the local market square of Itagüí. Before that he used to work transporting produce, but there came a time when he decided to start his own business and by using the contacts he had made on the job he was able to set up his stand and start earning an income on his own.

He is a very able person and his age doesn't prevent him from having dreams or getting excited about the future. He wants to leave his business to his children and for them to keep it going. 

He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale products to stock his stand with a variety of produce. The help from this loan will allow him to ensure his business prevails.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Sineth's Group

texts.en: Sineth is a villager of a district located in Battambang province. She is a 26-year-old married woman who is blessed with two children. The primary source of income for the family comes from a photography shop which she has managed for about 7 years. She also sells grocery items to generate extra money. The average income for the family is only 23,500 KHR per day.  She leads a group of two members to request a loan of 3,000,000 KHR of which Sineth will use a portion of 2,000,000 KHR. She plans to use her share of loan to buy more grocery items for resale in a hope of increasing the income to better support the family. She believes that the loan will unlock a way for her family to live in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food he needs for his business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 34, is married with three children. She resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung khmum district, in Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband have been farming rice and working as construction workers. She is able to earn about $13 (USD) per day to meet the family’s need.

Sophy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizers and to plow the field as well as to use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner and also hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to plow the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: Aged 48 and a resident in Battbambang province, Rin is a widow and a married mother blessed with three kids. She strives for a living via running a small shop to sell phone. She has involved in current business for 13 years. This is the first loan for Rin with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, she joins a group of two to get a loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy household appliance for her family. She hopes to own a necessary items for her family.

loans.use: To buy household appliance for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish ready-made women's clothes

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 years, Sopha is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children. She earns a living through growing cassava which she had been doing for 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 38,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future. 

This is the fifth loan for Sopha with VisionFund. She has used the loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her new group to seek for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her supporting her cassava growing. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for supporting her cassava growing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Al- Rabi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Rabi. It consists of four women. They are living in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. She is the leader of the group. Fatima lives with her family in their own house. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The house of the family is very old and is threatening to fall down at any time. Now the family lives in that house. It needs a necessary renovation. Unfortunately, Fatima's husband is the sole breadwinner and his income is not enough to renovate the house. As a result, Fatima is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as bricks, iron steel, and cement to complete the building of the house.

Fatima's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating them. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, iron steel, and cement to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Yusha'u

texts.en:
Yusha'u is a 40-year-old farmer from Sarkin Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Yusha'u is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusha'u can earn up to $2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare--double the national average of 14. 

However, Yusha'u is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 150 bags of maize per hectare this season. Yusha'u is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Bashir and Isamail. Yusha'u’s dreams do not end there: “Ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” he expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his maize yield and income.

loans.name: Abdulahi A

texts.en:
Abdulahi A is a 50-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Abdulahi A is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Abdulahi A can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Abdulahi A is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  80 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Abdulahi A is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Zaharfini and  Sahbi.

Abdulahi A’s dreams do not end here: “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a 50-year-old farmer from Sarkin Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Kabiru can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Kabiru is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  70 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Kabiru is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Yakub and Zad. 

Kabiru’s dreams do not end here. “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Al- Asdika Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asdika. The group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. The women applied for a group loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Qamer is the leader of the group. She is a 26-year-old single woman living with her family in the city of Taiz, Yemen. She studied up to the elementary education level. Due to the miserable condition of her family, she couldn't complete her studies. Qamer didn't surrender to her miserable condition, but decided to work selling clothes for women and children. She started this business more than four years ago, opening a small shop for selling clothes to her customers. Qamer has found this business to be profitable for her. to fund further expansion, Qamer requested a loan portion of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase additional stylish ready-made clothes for women and children to resell to her customers.

Qamer looks forward to expanding her business further through opening a large shop from which to sell all of the stylish clothes.

loans.use: to purchase additional stylish ready-made clothing for women and children to resell.

loans.name: Balarabe

texts.en:
Balarabe is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization farmer from Sarkin Gwanki. Balarabe expressed that he is driven by one goal: "to make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Balarabe to join Babban Gona. 

Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Balarabe can earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Balarabe is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 62 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Balarabe will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. 

When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Balarabe will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a 34-year-old farmer from Arewa Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Amadu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Amadu can earn up to $2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize--more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Amadu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 62 bags of maize per hectare this season. Amadu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Abdullashi and  Ahamsi. Amadu’s dreams do not end here: “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his maize yield and income.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en: Tasiu is a 37-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Tasiu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tasiu can earn up to $2000 per ha (hectare) this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Tasiu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Tasiu is hopeful about what the future holds. He hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Ala and  Sosa. Tasiu’s dreams do not end here. “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he explained.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира заботливая мать. Она сама воспитывала и вырастила дочь, так как ее муж умер давно. Шоира занимается бизнесом. Она 5 лет назад открыла салон красоты. Она предоставляет услуги как стрижка волос, прическа волос, миникюр, пидикюр, макияж и т.п. Шоира знает своё дело хорошо и выполняет качественно. Она недавно сделала ремонт у себя в салоне. Теперь она хочет купить оборудование для своего салона. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shoira is a loving mother. She brought up her daughter by herself, as her husband died a long time ago. Five years ago she opened a beauty salon, providing services such as haircuts, hair designs, manicures, pedicures, makeup, etc. She knows her business well and performs high quality work. She recently made repairs at the salon and now she wants to buy some equipment. This is why she is asking for a loan of $1,000 (USD). She awaits your kindness and hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Savoeurn is a local resident from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. He has five children, two of whom are in school. He covers the needs in his household via rice farming and a rice bran selling business. He has had the business for 20 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Savoeurn is a fourth-time borrower and has repaid back his past loans completely. This has enabled him to improve his lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, he is teaming up with a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crop and to buy rice bran for resale. He strongly believes that he can earn more income so that he can own a decent house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop and to buy rice bran for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Wunzooya – Kpataribogu Group

texts.en:
Safura is 45 years old and married with five children. Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group called Wunzooya-Kpataribogu from a village called Kpataribogu in Ghana's Northern Region.

Safura has been doing this business with her other colleagues in the Wunzooya-Kpataribogu group for the past four years. The group has asked for a loan of 8,100 GHS. Safura’s share of it would be used to buy five bags of shea nuts and some fuel to power the processing of the shea nuts. There are available off-taker organizations and individuals who buy the shea butter Safura processes because of its premium quality. 

Safura hopes to continuously expand this business to a point where she can directly build a market network in Europe and the USA for her shea butter product. She also hopes to grow her income, be able to repay this loan, and take good care of the children's education and health.

loans.use: To buy five bags of shea nuts and some fuel to power the processing of the shea nuts.

loans.name: Moneer Group

texts.en:
Moneer is a group which comprises of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.
	
Reyadha is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. Reyadha's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Their house lacks a refrigerator. Inside the kitchen of the house, Reyadha puts many kinds of drinks and sweets which need to be in a cold condition. Particularly, the climate is very hot in these days and the cold water is very necessary for the family. 

Because the family doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep the drinks, foods and water in a cold condition, most of those items expire quickly. For this reason, Reyadha is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house. 

Reyadha looks forward to improving the living condition of her family. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Eng is 25 years old and a young mother blessed with two daughters: one under school-aged kid and one schoolchild. 

For her family, cassava farming and the grocery business are the main sources of income to support her family. This is the second-cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which has enabled her to uplift her condition of living better than before and to have sufficient food in her household. 

She is a leader of a group consisting of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and cassava seedlings and pay for plowing and labor costs. 

She strongly hopes to harvest more cassava and to increase her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and cassava seedlings and pay for plowing and labor costs.

loans.name: Ear's Group

texts.en:
Ear is a villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province where rice is the most popular crop in the area. She is 47 years old and a mother of two children. Similar to those in her neighborhood, she also grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee. 

This is the fourth loan for Ear with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to raise her living conditions at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she has teamed up as a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fees for her farm. She hopes to prepare her farmland in a timely way so that she can make more income.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fees for her farm.

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three, Song lives with her family in a district of Battambang province. She is 49 years old and has three children, one of whom still needs her support. 

Cassava planting is the family's main business and main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a labor wage to make additional income. 

Song is not new to VisionFund. She is now on her twelfth loan, which she will spend on fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava plantation. Hopefully, the crops will produce a higher yield and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Kunthy's Group

texts.en: Kunthy is a resident of Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province. She is a young mother who has one little child. The main sources of her family's income are from rice, sesame, bean, and maize farming--plus her job. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs to pump water for her maize farm. She strongly believes that she can get a better yield than before. She will use the additional income to send her child to school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs to pump water

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sam Ath's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Kampong Cham province, Sam Ath is a 33-year-old local farmer who makes a living via rice cropping on a two-hectare area. She has been involved in the current business for 13 years, and it currently earns her almost 39,000 KHR per day. 

This is the original loan for Sam Ath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She teamed up with a group of five to get a new loan. The entire loan amount in her group is 5,400,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chhneang's Group

texts.en: A resident from Sangke district of Battambang province, Chhneang is 44 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is in school. Her entire family solely counts on rice farming and making handmade tools for catching fish for supplementary income. Chhneang is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has had four past loans already with a successful repayment and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle progressively. For this cycle, four borrowers have joined together as a group to get a microloan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with Chhneang as the leader. For Chhneang, she will spend some of her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee, to buy fertilizer and to spare some portion of her loan to buy bamboo to make tools for catching fish for resale. She hopes to earn more income to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to replace the roof and upgrade the walls of her home

loans.name: Rae's Group

texts.en:
Rae, a widowed mother of three, supports the family by farming rice, which is the only source of income. The income earned is just enough to support the daily foods for the family. Struggling with working capital for the business, Rae, after repaying the previous loans, decided to request a fourth loan from VisionFund. She hopes to get the money to buy fertilizers and pay for the ploughing fee. 

From this loan, Rae hopes to generate more income, allowing her to set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the ploughing fee.

loans.name: Neub's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Bovel district of Battambang province, Neub has five children, three of whom are still under her support. The family's primary source of income is from rice farming. They also plant green peppers for sale to make additional income. 

Neub has spent her savings on home improvement. As the transplanting season arrived, Neub requested another loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers for the crops and also to spend on the land-ploughing fee. She hopes the crops this year will produce a higher quality so that she can sell them for more profit.

loans.use: to pay for the land-ploughing fee and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristina Vanessa

texts.es: Cristina de 23 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos dos niñas de 6 y 2 años y un niño de 2 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se gana la vida gracias a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés la cual realiza de lunes a domingo en su vivienda y los alrededores, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo de albañil. Cristina desea poner techo en su vivienda y terminar las paredes de esta para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar láminas y polines para el techo y comprará ladrillo y cemento para terminar las paredes.
texts.en:
Cristina is 23 years old and lives with her life partner and their three children. They have two daughters, 6 and 2 years old, and a son who is 2 months old. She is a very hardworking woman and earns a living selling sweet rolls and French bread seven days a week from her home and in surrounding areas. Her partner also supports the family income as a bricklayer.

Cristina wants to put a roof on their home and to finish building the walls. She requests a loan from FUSAI to purchase laminate sheets and poles for the roof, and to purchase bricks and cement to complete the walls.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to finish constructing her roof and walls.

loans.name: Sochenda

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sochenda is 29 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two daughters and one son. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and sesame planting. She has been in this business for several years.
