Sochenda has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana, 25, lives with her husband and one daughter in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her daughter by raising pigs. She has been in the business for five years, while her husband works for others for a fee to better support her family. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Ratana is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is applying for a loan to buy piglets and pigs. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: start up his internet cafe, buy computers and a show case

loans.name: Bunthoern

texts.en:
Bunthoern lives in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He is 38 years old and married with two babies. To support his family, he has been growing cassava and farming rice for more than five years. 

Bunthoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now he is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 26, is a married mother living with her child in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and working as a paid construction worker in order to supplement her income. She has been in this business for six years, earning about 43,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day and is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day after expenses for future needs.

Rem has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Thorn is now 34 years old and married. She has three children. Thorn and her husband are rice farmers who have engaged in the business for 16 years. To better support themselves, they also work as construction workers. The current business earns them about 43,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs and they can afford to save about 25,000 KHR each day.

Thorn is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her rice farming. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to make more healthy rice to make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Noern

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Cheung Prey district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Noern, 35, is married with seven children. She and her husband grow rice and work for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 35 years, they can earn about 37,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about 22,000 KHR each day. 

Noern is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. She is going to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sreymao is aged 44 years and married with two children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Sreymao with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Touch is now 33 years old and married. She has four children. Touch and her husband are farmers who grow rice and plant cassava as their main business to support the family. Having been in the business for 16 years, they are able to make daily earnings of 38,000 KHR and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Touch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rorm's Group

texts.en: Residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Rorm is a local farmer in his late 40s. He grows rice as his main source of income. Besides his agribusiness, he drives a tri-cycle motorbike for a fee to supplement his income. Rorm has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a long time, and he has fully repaid his past loans completely. For this cycle, he leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for his crops. He hopes that he can get a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Kry is a 51-year-old mother of two dependent children, who are still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area. Having been in the business for 33 years, she can earn daily income of approximately 32,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) and is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Kry with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy. This loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully. She also hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is aged 40 years and married with three children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by fishing. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for Sam with VisionFund. She is now leading her group. She wants to use her portion to buy materials for fixing her boat. She hopes this loan will enable her to fix her boat so as to catch more fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials for fixing her boat

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and she has been in this business for 15 years and she also works as garment worker. The current business earns her family about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Vanny with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is a 36-year-old mother of five children living in a rural village of the Prey Chor district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for years and her husband supplements the family’s income by fishing. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Sorn with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy materials for fixing her boat for fishing. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chor district, Sokhorn is 44 years old and married. She has three children. She has been catching fish. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day. 

Sokhorn is just with VisionFund for this cycle and completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sokhorn wants to use her portion to buy materials for supporting her fishing business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her fishing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy casual clothing in order to increase his sales volume

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos: una niña de 12 años y dos niños de 4 y 1 año de edad. Ella se gana la vida lavando y planchando  diferentes domicilios cercanos a su cantón. Su compañero de vida también aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo de oficios varios. Teresa desea  cambiar las columnas de su vivienda que son de madera por unas de cemento, también desea encementar y cambiar el techo del patio de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y hierro para las columnas y encementar el piso y lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo.
texts.en: Teresa, 31 years old, lives with her husband and her three children: a daughter who is two years old and two sons, ages 4 and 1.  She earns a living washing and ironing for several households near her town.  Her partner in life also contributes to household finances through his work at various trades. Teresa wants to change the columns of her house which are made of wood for cement ones.  She wants to cement the patio  of her home and change its roof.  She is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron for the columns and to cement the floor, and to buy metal sheeting, bolts and planks to change the roof.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron for the columns of her house and to cement the patio floor, and to buy metal sheeting, bolts and planks to change the roof

loans.name: Sivkek's Group

texts.en:
Sivkek is a 49-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing various kinds of vegetables for 31 years, earning about 33,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sivkek’s group consists of two females who live in the same village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. A first-time borrower with  VisionFund, Sivkek, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kimheang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Kimheang is a 47-year-old mother of seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. The main source of the family’s income is rice farming, which Kimheang has been involved in for 29 years; she can earn about KHR30,000 per day to meet daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Kimheang’s group of two members. As the leader, Kimheang will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and pay for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un hombre trabajador, tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace para poder obtener resultados favorables. Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cacao el principal producto cultivado debido a las condiciones favorables del ambiente. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, emprendedor y por supuesto ofrece productos de excelente calidad.
Domingo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar fertilizantes para poder abonar sus cultivos y de esta manera pueda obtener productos de mejor calidad y mayor producción. Así seguirá luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y convertirse en el mejor productor de cacao de la zona.
texts.en:
Domingo is a hard-working man, 59 years old.  He is married and lives in San Martin with his family.  He has a great desire to get ahead in life, and because of this always strives for success in everything he does.  Domingo has been working at farming for more than eight years, with cacao the main crop he raises due to the favorable environmental conditions.  This work is going well for Domingo because he is very responsible and enterprising, and of course because he offers products of excellent quality.

Domingo is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they provide he can buy fertilizers for his crops and thus have higher quality products and greater productivity.   He will continue fighting to improve his family's quality of life and become the best cacao producer in his area.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products (fertilizers) to care for his crops

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Khorn is 45 years old and a widowed mother blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. She tackles  her family’s hardships via rubber and pepper farming as her main source of income, and she also earns income by doing paid work. 

This will be Khorn's second micro loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. Her previous one, since repaid, has enabled her to gradually upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she leads a group of three to request a new loan. As the leader, Khorn will use her entire portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can gain a yield better than her previous one.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Al- Saada Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Saada. The group consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Taiz, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. As a group, they applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB. 

Afrah is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She is the leader of the group. Afrah lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. Afrah supported him with a lot of her own money. Many years ago, Afrah and her husband built their own house on the land they bought. Now the family lives in their own house, but it is still not completed. As a result, Afrah is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials as bricks, iron steel, and cement to complete the building of the house.

Afrah's dream for the future is to build one more floor and renovate further. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials as bricks, iron steel, and cement to complete the building of the house

loans.name: Byamungu M Group

texts.fr: Chalazire est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Byamungu M», entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 49 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché du centre ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de sa grande sœur. Son conjoint est un boucher. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 34 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 régimes de bananes, poissons frais, 40 kg de légumes et canne à sucre. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Chalazire is a saleswoman, and a member of the "Byamungu M" community bank. She is an experienced, dynamic entrepreneur - 49 years old and the mother of 9 children who are all in education. She is a seller of foodstuffs, and operates from the market in the town centre. She began in business with money received from her elder sister. Her husband is a butcher. Subsequently, she benefited from the loan from the Hekima IMF. She has been in this business for over 34 years. She will use this new loan to purchase 50 bunches of bananas, fresh fish, and 40 kilos of vegetables and sugar cane.
Thus, she hopes to build her home, and to school, clothe and feed her children.
Finally, she warmly thanks Hekima for helping non-bankable women entrepreneurs to achieve autonomy; particularly during this difficult time with war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bunches of bananas, fresh fish, 40 kilos of vegetables and sugar cane.

loans.name: Institut Kyeshero I Group

texts.fr: Muhima est un commerçant depuis 32 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Institut Kyeshero I», senior entrepreneur dynamique, âgé de 50 ans, marié et père de 12 enfants, dont 9 étudient et 3 sont encore petit. Il est vendeur des divers matériels métalliques. Il étale sa marchandise dans le marché périphérique de la ville et s’entraide avec son épouse. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des ferres à bétons, tôles, clous, fus etc. Il commença ses business avec de fonds reçu d’un bienfaiteur. Dans l’avenir, il souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une belle maison, scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux petits entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en: Muhima has been a businessman for 32 years and is a member of the "Institut Kyeshero I" business group. He is a senior, dynamic entrepreneur - 50 years old, married and the father of 12 children, 9 of whom are in education and the other 3 are still too young. He is a seller of various ironmongery. He offers his wares in the market on the outskirts of town, and works along with his wife. He is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to grow his business. He will purchase iron for concrete construction, metal sheets, nails, screws etc. He began his business with funding received from a donation. In the future, he hopes to grow his capital, build a nice house, and to feed and educate his children. He thanks Hekima for the support offered to non-bankable small businesspeople.

loans.use: to purchase iron for concrete pouring, sheet metal, nails and screws etc.

loans.name: Byamungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katambayi  est commerçante depuis 26 ans, présidente  et membre d’une association d’affaires « Byamungu», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants, dont 5 étudient encore et 5 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique, chez elle à domocile. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un retraité. Elle va acheter des cartons de bombons, des biscuits, jus, lait sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé etc. Dans l’avenir, Elle compte construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The client Katambayi  has been in business for 26 years and is the president and member of a business group called "Byamungu". She is a 61 year old senior, dynamic entrepreneur - married and the mother of 10 children; 5 are still studying and 5 are married. She sells various items and operates a small shop from her home.She is seeking a loan from Hekima to grow her business, which she began with funding received from her husband, who is retired. 
She will buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, juice, milk, sugar, rice, oils, soap powder, cosmetic products, 1 box of exercise books, 5 boxes of pens, matches, iodised salt, etc. In the future, she plans to construct her own home, and to feed and school her children. Thus, she thanks Hekima for the support for female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies for resale.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Nan is 28 years old and a married mother blessed with two little kids. Her main sources of income are from maize farming on 1.5 hectares and her paid job. This is the first loan for Nan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is teaming up with a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and to pay the plowing fee. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Chhun Eang's Group

texts.en: Chhun Eang,48, is a mother of three children. She is a local farmer in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province.  Her household counts entirely on her maize farming business on 1.5 hectares of farmland. She has been farming for five years and earns about 37,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Chhun Eang and her co-borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For the group of three, she is the leader. For Chhun Eang, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield better than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a resident of Battambang province, where rice farming on three hectares of land is her main source of income. She also earns income through paid work. A mother of  five children, she uses her income to support her family.

Yoeurn leads a group of two in this loan request from Kiva partner VisionFund. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She believes this will enable her to enhance her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from the Phom Proek district of Battambang province, Mom is a mother of four children, three in school. She earns a living through corn farming on two hectares of land. A first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Mom leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion on the plowing fee and to buy seed for her crop. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and to buy seed.

loans.name: Shauri Group

texts.fr: Christine est une commerçante depuis 16 ans, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires «Shauri», âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère des 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés. Elle étale ses marchandises dans le marché du centre ville. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima. Son conjoint est un infirmier dans un centre hospitalier. Elle va acheter 20 paires de souliers, pour accroitre son entreprise.  Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Christine has been in business for sixteen years, and is president and a member of the "Shauri" business group.She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 4 children - all of whom are in education. She is a seller of secondhand footwear. She offers her merchandise in the central market. She is seeking a loan from Hekima. Her husband is a nurse in a hospital. She is going to buy 20 pairs of shoes, to grow her business, which she started with funding from her husband. In the future, she wants to feed and educate her children. Thus, she thanks Hekima for their support for female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase twenty pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Kimhuoy's Group

texts.en: Kimhuoy, 23, is a young mother of two children residing in Battambang province. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice cropping and maize farming. It is the business that she has had for 15 years. This is the fourth loan for Kimhuoy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. In this cycle, she teams up with a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fee, and to pay for labor costs. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fee, and to pay for labor cost

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: A resident in Bovel district of Battambang province, Chanthy is 30 years old and a mother of four children; three are in school and one is too young for schooling. To struggle for a living, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and runs a small stall to charge batteries. To earn more income, she works for others for a fee. Chanthy, a third-cycle borrower, joins a group of two with a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan completely, and now her living condition is getting better than before. As a group leader, Chanthy will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and rice seed. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can make more income so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and rice seed

loans.name: Kimvang's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Kimvang is 46 years old and married. The main sources of her family income are rice farming and her paid job. She has been in business for 27 years, earning about 20,900 KHR per day. Kimvang, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her past seven loans with a successful repayment history, has joined a group of three to take out another loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and to renovate her house. She hopes to fix her house and to get a good yield from her crop.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une commerçante depuis 20 ans, vice-présidente et membre de la banque villageoise «Uhuru», âgée de 55 ans, veuve et mère des 9 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés. Elle étale ses marchandises dans un marché de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima. Elle va acheter 15 paires de souliers pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et leur assurer les soins médicaux. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Jacqueline has been in business for twenty years, and is vice-president and a member of the "Uhuru" village group.She is 55 years old, a widow and the mother of 9 children - all of whom are in education. She is a seller of secondhand footwear. She offers her merchandise in a market on the square. She is seeking a loan from Hekima. She is going to buy 15 pairs of shoes, to grow her business, which she started with funding from her boyfriend. In the future, she wants to feed and educate her children, and cover their medical care. Thus, she thanks Hekima for their support for female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en: Sophan is 41 years old and a resident of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children and she earns a living by weaving cotton scarves called kramars and farming. She has been involved in her current business for 23 years. This is the second loan for Sophan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she joins group of six borrowers to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to reap the crop’s yield on time so that she can make more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Thoeurm's Group

texts.en: Thoeurm, aged 36 and a local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is a mother of three kids, two of whom still count on her, as one is too young for schooling and one is in school.  For her family, rice cropping and her paid-working job are the sources of her family’s income. It is the business that she has had for 15 years. Thoeurm is a fourth-time borrower who has fully repaid her past loan completely with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice insecticide for her crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield with good income so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy rice insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en: Chamroeun and her family, consisting of three children, live in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district. She is a rice grower and a vendor who can earn about 28,100 KHR per day to secure the basic needs of her household. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Chamroeun is on her fifth loan and her co-borrower is on her fourth loan. Chamroeun has repaid her past loans and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR, the same amount as her co-borrower. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield to make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
A Paula le encantan los niños, ella es madre de un pequeño bebe de 1 año pero desde siempre ha sentido gran gusto por los bebes y todo lo relacionado con estos.
Ella abrió un negocio de venta de ropa y juguetes para bebe hace aproximadamente un año y en estos momentos lo está tratando de surtir poco a poco.
Ella solicita un préstamo para obtener la ayuda necesaria y así poder surtir su negocio con elementos como ropa, vitaminas, juguetes y otros elementos para el cuidado y diversión de los niños.
Ella sabe lo difícil que es ser mama y con su labor ayuda a otras madres a que este proceso sea un poco más ligero.
Toda su atención está centrada en su bebe y siempre procura por ofrecerle lo mejor para su correcto desarrollo.
texts.en:
Paula loves children, she is the mother of a 1-year old baby and she has always felt great happiness for infants as well as everything relating to infants.
She opened an infant clothing and toy retailer store approximately one year ago and at this moment she is trying to stock the store. 

She is requesting a loan in order to obtain the necessary help and that way she can stock her business with items such as clothing, vitamins, toys and other items for the care and the enjoyment of children. 

She understands the hardships of being a mother and with her work she aids other mothers to make it easier for them. She focuses all of her attention in her baby and she always tries to provide the best for his proper development.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, vitamins and toys for infants.

loans.name: Laiheng's Group

texts.en: Laiheng, a resident of Koh Sotin, is a mother of three children. She makes a living through silk weaving and a fishing business. She has been involved in her current business for 13 years, earning about 41,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Laiheng's group consisting of three borrowers. Laiheng has fully repaid her past loan and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. For this loan, she is group leader.  For Laiheng, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy silk thread and artificial color for dyeing.

loans.use: To buy silk thread and artificial color for dyeing

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en: A local resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Hor is 63 years old and a married father blessed with eight children. He earns a living through rice farming and his paid job. This is not the first loan for Hor with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his past loan completely and it enabled him to improve his lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, he joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay the plowing fee, and to buy insecticide. He hopes that he can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay the plowing fee, and buy insecticide

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Battambang Province’s Bovel district is the residential area of Bopha and her family. She is 48 years old and a married mother of six children. She tackles her basic needs via rice cropping, a fish-selling business, and her job as a paid worker.  

This is the third loan for Bopha and second loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Bopha has completely repaid her past loan and now her living conditions are getting better. 

As a leader, Bopha will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seeds for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Thuch's Group

texts.en: A villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province, Thuch is 61 years old and married. She is a local farmer who grows rice as the main source of income and she supplements her income via dessert selling. This is not the original loan for Thuch with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. For Thuch, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and rice seed. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and rice seed

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en: A local citizen from Kampong Cham province, Navy is 52 years old and a widow. She earns a living farming rice on one hectare of farmland. This is the first loan for Navy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and insecticide. She hopes to gain a good yield from her harvest so that she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop and insecticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 55 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y los dos hijos de ambos han procreado una niña de 12 años y un niño de 14 años de edad. Él se gana la vida como jornalero en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 25 años. Salvador desea poner ladrillo de piso en su vivienda además instalar las tuberías de aguas negras y lluvias para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para poner ladrillo de piso y comprar tubos, codos y pegamento para instalación de tuberías de aguas negras.
texts.en: Salvador is 55 years-old and he lives with his life partner and both of his sons have raised a 12- year old girl and a 14 year-old boy. He has made a living as a day laborer at the local market for the past 25 years. Salvador wishes to install brick floor in his house as well as installing pipes for sewer lines and rain, hence he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to purchase brick floor, cement, sand, gravel; and to pay manual laborers to install brick floor; and pipes, cubits and adhesive to install the pipes for sewer lines.

loans.use: to purchase brick floor, cement, sand, gravel and to pay manual labor to install brick floor and pipes and cubits and adhesive to install the pipes for sewer lines.

loans.name: Tito Eliseo

texts.es: Tito de 30 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad. ÉL es un hombre muy tenaz que se gana la vida elaborando pan francés y pan dulce además él mismo lo distribuye de manera ambulante logrando así un ingreso extra para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su esposa también aporta económicamente al hogar con su  trabajo en un supermercado. Tito desea colocar techo a dos cuartos de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y pines y así dar una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Tito is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 5 year old son. He is a very persistent man who makes his living selling French bread and pastries. He distributes them himself in the streets to make an extra income to provide a better standard of living for his family. His wife also helps support the household economy by working in a supermarket. Tito wants to put a roof over two rooms of his house so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized laminate, rafters and  purlins to provide better security for his family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, rafters and purlins to put the roof on his house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Flora; la socia tiene 38 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio a la agricultura  a la venta de verduras y cereales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The partner is Flora.  She is 38 years old and married and has an agriculture business selling vegetables and cereals.  She is a responsible and earnest person, and has spent much time dedicating herself to this business which goes well thanks to the commitment that she puts into it everyday.  Flora desires to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  She requests a loan to buy fertilizer. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to the meet her established quotas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her agricultural business

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, aged 42 and married, is a local farmer who grows rice on four hectares and sesame on another four hectare area. She can earn more income via her paid-working job. This is the fourth loan for Chenda with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it enables her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. Chenda will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good income so she can keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en: Yeng, 51, is a villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province. She is a married mother who earns a living by farming rice and cassava. She can supplement her income as a paid worker. This is the third loan for Yeng and the first loan for her joint borrower in the group of two. The past loans that Yeng has fully repaid allowed her to upgrade her living condition at a gradual pace. Now, she is a group leader. For Yeng, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and to buy seed for replanting. She hopes that she can gain a triple yield so as she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and to buy seed for replanting

loans.name: Nhean's Group

texts.en:
A 56-year-old married mother blessed with five children, Nhean supports her entire family via rice cropping and her paid-working job. It is the business that she has had for 15 years. Including this loan, Nhean is a sixth-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seed. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and seed.

loans.name: Générosité A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamate est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Générosité A », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui  tous  étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes de première qualité (Super wax). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 27 pièces de pagnes.  Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kamate, a merchant, is a member of the business group “Générosité A”. At 35 years old, she is a dynamic entrepreneur and the widowed mother of three children who all go to school. 

Kamate sells high quality, super wax pagnes (colorful cloth). She conducts her sales at the local market, which is a busy place. She has partnered with the Hekima MFI for financial assistance. 

Kamate has been engaged in this activity for 10 years, and she plans to use this new loan to buy 27 pagnes. 

Her goals for the future are to buy a plot of land, and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. 

Kamate wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping women entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these difficult times following the war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 27 pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en: Chheng, aged 53 and married, is a resident from the Bovel district of Battambang province. She strives for a living via rice farming and a paid-working job. This is the first loan for Chheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy seed. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and buy seed.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, aged 30 and a resident of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is a mother of three children who are too young for schooling. Her main source of income is from growing rice, which she has been involved with for several years. It earns her about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day. 

Including this loan, she and her co-borrowers are in their third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans completely. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. For Na, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyoeur's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoeur, a local resident from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, is 32 years old and married. She tackles her daily cost of living via rice farming and cassava farming. This farming generates her about 27,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day from the business that she has had for 13 years.

This is the second loan for Sreyoeur and the first loan for her co-borrower in a group of two. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing costs. She has high hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Bovel district of Battamabang province, Phally is 54 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. She is cassava grower and a local rice farmer. She can earn more income via the paid-working job. This is the third loan for Phally and the first loan for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan with success. 

Now, she is a leader. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee, buy rice seed and pay a transplanting fee. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee, buy rice seed and pay a transplanting fee.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is 55 years old and a mother of six children. She is a local farmer and resides in Kampong Cham province where cassava is a well-known product in the area. 

Growing rice and farming cassava are her main source of income which generate her about 38,000 KHR per day to support the needs of her family.  

Saret, a fourth-time borrower, formed a group of two to obtain a new loan with a first-time borrower from VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. Saret has repaid back her past loans completely, and this has enabled her to gradually improve her lifestyle. For this loan cycle, she is the leader. 

Saret will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, to buy rice seed, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sochat's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44 and a local farmer from Bovel district of Battambang province, Sochat is a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. To cover the needs in her household, Sochat grows cassava, maize and rice as the main source of income, and she also works as a paid-worker to supplement her income. This is not the first loan for Sochat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it has helped her to uplift her lifestyle gradually. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, Sochat will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and the transplanting fee. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and the transplanting fee.

loans.name: Yaet's Group

texts.en:
Yaet is 43 years old and a married mother of four children residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She is a farmer who grows rice as her main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for seven years. 

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Yet now forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can gain a triple yield with a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma Elena

texts.es: Vilma de 22 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que mantiene la economía familiar por medio de la venta de ropa para mujer que realiza todos los días de forma ambulante en el mercado central además buscando tener mejores ingresos vende lociones para hombre y mujer. Vilma desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijo para lo que quiere encementar el patio de la vivienda que actualmente es de tierra como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, grava, cemento y pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Vilma is a 22 year old single mother who lives with her 6 year old child. She is a very enterprising woman who supports the family economy by selling clothing for women. She does this every day strolling around the central market. She is also looking to make more income buying lotions for men and women. Vilma wants to improve the living conditions for her son so she wants to cement over the patio of her house. It is now made of earth as shown in the photo. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, cement and to pay for labor to cement over the patio of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement. sand. gravel and pay for labor to cement over the floor of her house.

loans.name: Tiththeary's Group

texts.en: Tiththeary is 29 years old and a mother of two kids. For her family, two hectares of rice farming is the main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 5 years, earning about 36,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Tiththeary and her co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed.

loans.name: Sak's Group

texts.en:
Sak is 52 years old and married. She lives in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She and her husband have six children.

Sak and her husband earn a living through farming rice, and they have been in this business for almost 34 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Sak with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. 

Sak hopes to have larger crop yields and sell for a good price so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Savin is 50 years old and a married mother of three children. For her family, growing rice is the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for ages and it earns her about 27,800 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day. 

This is not the first loan for Savin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loans completely. Now, she joins a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash (salts containing water-soluble potassium) and seeds for replanting her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy potash and seeds for replanting her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Taihuon's Group

texts.en:
Taihuon, married with six children, is 51 years old and a local resident from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She deals with her daily costs of living via rice and cassava farming plus her paid-working job. These businesses generate her about 28,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day from the business that she has had for ages. 

This is not the first loan for Taihuon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loans, which allows her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is teaming up with a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay plowing fees, and to buy cassava seedlings. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay plowing fees, and to buy cassava seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un reconocido comercializador de ropa el cual ha ejercido su profesión por más de 13 años en un centro comercial donde su recorrido le ha traído fidelidad de clientes los cuales esta consiente que siempre debe tenerlos surtidos de variedad de productos por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de variedad de ropa la cual ofrecerá a sus clientes. 
Su principal sueño es mantener su negocio y tener continuidad en el tiempo.
texts.en: Fernando is a well-known seller of clothing. He has been exercising his profession for more than 13 years in a commercial center. His journey has won him the loyalty of his clients. He is always aware that he need to have a variety of stock to offer to his clients. His main dream is to keep his business running and sustainable in time.

loans.use: to buy clothing to offer variety to his clients.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol, 48, is a mother of six children. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district where she lives. Currently, she still needs to support two children who remain in school. 

This is the second loan for Thol with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid back her past loans completely, and the loans enable her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, she teamed up with a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers for her crops. 

Thol hopes to earn more income so that she can sufficiency support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nicolás Salvador

texts.es:
Nicolás de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la albañilería,esta acompañado, su pareja realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa, son padres de una hija que ya no vive con ellos solo un nieto que asiste a la escuela.  

Nicolás desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la albañilería (construcción de casas) su padre le inculco a trabajar muy duro,y no pudo estudiar todos los días trabaja de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar herramientas de albañilería, como cucharas, palas, escuadra, nivel, carretilla, ya que le urge puesto que tiene contratos de casas y es necesario andar muchas herramientas y así no pierde de trabajar y de esa forma la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El sueño de Nicolás es siempre mantener su trabajo y su salud para darles todo lo necesario a su familia,y tener su equipo de trabajo y seguir trabajando con credicampo.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 51, makes a living in masonry.  He is in a relationship and his partner performs the domestic duties in his house.  They are the parents of a daughter who no longer lives with them.  They have one grandson who attends school.

From an early age, Nicolas has made a living in masonry (house construction).  His father taught him to work very hard and he could not study.  Everyday he works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

He will use the loan to buy masonry tools such as trowels, shovels, a square, a level, and a wheelbarrow because he needs these things soon as he has contracts for houses and it is necessary to have many tools.  In this way, he will not lose work and will be able to satisfy his necessities.

Nicolas' dream is to always maintain his work and health in order to provide all the necessities for his family, to have his work team, and to continue working with CrediCampo

loans.use: to buy masonry tools such as trowels, shovels, a square, a level, and a wheelbarrow because he needs them soon as he has contracts for houses.

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Banteay Meanchey province, Mun is 45 years old and married. He has five children, three of whom are in school and still rely on him. For his family, one hectare of rice farming is the main source of income. This is the third loan for Mun and his co-borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The positive impact of the past loan, which he has fully repaid, has enabled him to uplift his lifestyle gradually. Now, he teams up in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide. He hopes that he can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nhoeurs' Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Nhoeurs is a married mother blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. For her, rice and corn farming are the main source of her income, and she has been involved in her current business for 13 years. 

This is the second microloan for Nhoeurs with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), with successful repayment of her past loan. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. For this cycle, she is a leader.  Nhoeurs will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Chanbo

texts.en: Chanbo, aged 46 and a widow, is a local farmer residing in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. For her family, rice cropping is the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for several years and currently it earns her about 29,200 KHR per day. Now, in a group of three, Chanbo and her co-borrowers are in their third loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She has fully repaid her past loan completely. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for labor costs for her crop. She hopes to earn a larger income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for labor costs for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savry's Group

texts.en:
Savry, 58, is a citizen from Banteay Meanchey province. She has eight children, three of whom are in school. To sustain her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is the seventh loan for Savry with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it improved her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes that she can gain a good income so she can start up her business in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en: Im is 39 years old and married. She is a resident of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Her main source of income is from working at a construction site. This is not Im's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She has fully repaid her past loan completely. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy important materials to support her occupation as a construction worker. She hopes to earn more income from her occupation.

loans.use: To buy important materials to support her occupation as a construction worker

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurng, a local farmer from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is 61 years old and married. For her family, cassava farming is the main source of income which generates her about 35,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Yoeurng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle more than before. 

Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Calvino

texts.es:
Calvino es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes, siempre ha luchado por ellos para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto cultivado es el cacao, actualmente está innovando en el cultivo de yuca, piña y plátano, lo cual espera con ansias la cosecha para poder ver los resultados. Es un gran productor y siempre ofrece productos de calidad en el mercado.
Calvino está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para poder abonar sus cultivos, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos con las ventas y seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Calvino is an entrepreneur.  He is 49 years old, single and lives in San Martin with his family.  He has two children who are now independent.  He has always fought to provide them with a better future.  For many years, he has worked in agriculture.  His primary crop is cacao, but he is now experimenting with yucca, pineapple and plantains, who's harvest he is anxiously awaiting to see the results.  He is a great producer and he always sells quality products in the market.  

Calvino is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the help that they have given him he will be able to purchase supplies to fertilize his crops.  This way he will generate greater earnings from his sales and be able to continue working to get his family ahead.

loans.use: purchase supplies to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Rut Noemi

texts.es: Rut de 37 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida con quien  ha procreado 4 hijos dos de los cuales son mayores de edad y aportan económicamente a la casa, además tienen un varón de 5 años y una niña de 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y con una gran visión para los negocios, ya que tiene una pequeña venta de tamales los cuales distribuye en los cantones vecinos. Además, compra cosméticos y ropa de gran variedad para vender, también su compañero de vida le ayuda a la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo de motorista. Ella desea terminar de construir su vivienda ya que tiene un cuarto a medio construir por lo que debe repellar y afinar las paredes, desea encementar un área de la casa y necesita hacer la instalación del sistema eléctrico para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, grava, ladrillo, arena y pagar mano de obra para terminar la construcción y hará la conexión de la energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Rut is 37 years old and lives with her husband with whom she has four children.  Two of her children are adults and contribute to the household financially.  They also have a five year old boy and a twelve year old girl.  Rut is an entrepreneurial woman with a great mind for business.  She has a small operation selling tamales which she distributes in the neighboring towns.  She also purchases cosmetics and clothing in bulk to sell.  Her husband also helps her with the household finances through his job as a driver.  

She wishes to finish building her home because there is one room that is still unfinished and the walls need to be plastered and refined.  She also wants to cement part of the house and she needs to install electricity.  For this she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, gravel, bricks, sand and to pay for labor to finish the construction and to install electricity.

loans.use: purchase cement, gravel, bricks, sand and pay for labor to finish construction, as well as to purchase wire, tubing and outlets to install electricity.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari, 45, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married, with two children. The family’s main sources of income are rice farming and selling snacks in the local village. She has been in this business for 15 years and she is able to earn about KHR 80,000 per day.

Sari is in her first microloan with VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income, so as to make a better living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Vann is 35 years old and a mother of three children. One child is under school-age and two are schoolchildren. They live in Kampong Cham province.

The main sources of her family's income are from one hectare of rice farming and her paid job working at the factory. 

Vann received her original loan from VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, and has completely repaid back her past loan. She formed a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

Vann hopes to gain a better yield than before so she can better support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kuoy's Group

texts.en:
Kuoy is a local farmer from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice farming on two hectares of farmland.  She can earn about KHR 28,000 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Kuoy with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan and now her living conditions are getting better. 

As a leader, Kuoy will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Tbaung Khmum of Kampong Cham province, Channa is 29 years old and a mother of three kids, two of whom are too young for schooling and one is in school. She handles her family’s hardship via rice farming. It is the business that she has had for 11 years, earning about 29,200 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Channa with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is teaming up a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for a land plowing fee. She strongly hopes to gain a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a land plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en: Phai, 28, is a resident from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two children. To provide for her family, working construction is her only source of income. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Phai with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid her past loans completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy materials to support her construction job. She hopes that she can make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy materials to support her construction job.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: Hun, a resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 49 years old and has three children. She deals with her daily cost of living by running a grocery stall and rice cropping. It is the business that she has had for ages. This is the sixth loan cycle for Hun and her co-borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has fully repaid her past loans completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she is a group leader. For Hun, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Luz Mayte

texts.es:
Luz es independiente desde hace aproximadamente 12 años, cuando inicio con su negocio de venta de comidas como fritos, pasteles, tinto, entre otros.
Desde ese momento se propuso una meta y fue la de sacar este negocio adelante para obtener así recursos y comprar su vivienda propia; hoy en día ese sueño está a punto de hacerse realidad gracias su gran empuje y tenacidad para trabajar.
Ella ofrece empleo a una señora (Ver Foto) quien le ayuda todo el día con la preparación y venta de sus productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido e insumos, adicionalmente requiere de mantenimiento para su carro de comidas el cual utiliza para trabajar.
texts.en:
Luz has been an independent business owner since 12 years ago when she started her business selling fried foods, pastries, coffee, and other products.  From that moment she set the goal of getting this business ahead to earn a living and be able to purchase her own home.  Today, this dream is on the verge of becoming a reality thanks to her effort and tenacious work.  She employees a woman (seen in the picture) who helps her everyday preparing and selling her products.

She is seeking a loan to purchase an assortment and supplies as well as to perform maintenance on the food cart that she uses for work.

loans.use: purchase an assortment and supplies, as well as perform maintenance on her food cart.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem is 35 years old and a mother of four children. She is a resident of Kampong Cham province. 

She deals with her daily cost of living with one hectare of rice crops and working at her paid job. She has been occupied with her current business for several years and earns almost 39,000 KHR per day on average. 

Now, she is a leader of a group of three. She is requesting a second loan, and her joint borrowers are applying for their first loan. 

Saem will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She strongly believes that she can obtain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Kanha is 25 years old and married, with three children. One child is in school while the other two are too young for school. 

Kanha and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. To gain more income to better support the family, they also work for others for a fee. Kanha and her husband have been in this business for several years. 

Kanha has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, for five loan cycles and she successfully paid back the past loans. The loans from VisionFund Cambodia have helped her family relieve the family’s business. 

Kanha is now leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will use a portion of it to buy grocery items. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel es un joven de 36 años de edad  soltero  y trabaja en una empresa como Administrador y asistente de organización y métodos. Estudio Excel avanzado para el manejo de su base de datos, dedica cuatro horas a sus estudios. Solicito el préstamo para cubrir el pago de su matrícula y  mensualidades de la universidad y ampliar sus conocimientos en informática, se siente agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por la ayuda que le dan y dice que no los va a defraudar. Envía saludos y les dice que sigan a poyando a quienes más lo necesitan.
texts.en: Manuel is a young man 36 years old, single and works for a company as an administrator and organization and methods assistant.  He studies advanced Excel in order to manage his database and he puts four hours into his studies.  He asked for the loan to cover the registration cost and the monthly payments for the university and to expand his knowledge in information technology.  He feels grateful to the Kiva investors for the help that they give and he says he will not disappoint them.  He sends his greetings and he says that they should continue supporting those who most need it.

loans.use: to make the registration payment and monthly payments for the university.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Ly is age 43, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Out of her seven children, she still has two dependent children who are still in school. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and raising pigs as the main sources of the family’s income; they have been in this business for 23 years. To better support her family, they also work as paid workers.

Ly is in her fifth cycle with VisionFund, while her group member has been in for two cycles. Ly completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her relieve the family’s burden. 

Now she is leading her group to seek for a new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Alvaro De Jesus

texts.es:
Álvaro es un campesino de 58 años de edad, trabajador y humilde.
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de café y plátano, cultivos que asiste todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Montebello. 
Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 
Álvaro, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a 58-year-old farmer who is hardworking and humble. This has allowed him to progress and today he has coffee and banana crops. He tends to these crops every day and sells his harvest at the market in the plaza in the Montebello municipality.

With the support of the loan, he will purchase agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, fertilizers, and other things. With these supplies, he will continue to care for his crops so that he will have a better and more productive harvest, which will allow him to increase his income when he sells his products.

Álvaro, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength, and tenacity, would like to continue fighting to achieve his dream, which is to have his own farm where he can grow a better variety of products and improve the profitability of his business. This will provide economic stability so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sokphai's Group

texts.en:
Sokpai is aged 31 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and she has two children. To make a living, she has been in selling grocery items for 11 years. 

Sokphai’s group consists of two members who are both female, and they have just been with VisionFund for this cycle. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend for labor. 

She hopes to increase her crop yields, and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Age 54 years old, Hun is a rural villager from the Moung Russey district. She earns a living through growing rice and working as a paid worker as her main sources of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 11 years. Hun has six children, two of whom are in school. 

Hun’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is a third cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Thorn is 54 years old and single. To make a living, she has been working as a cleaner in one hotel in a local area for 34 years. The current job earns her about US$12 per day. 

Thorn is in her first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now she is asking for a loan to buy household appliances for her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.
