loans.use: to buy household appliances for her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 35 years old; she is living with her husband and one son in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income; they have been doing this for about fifteen years. To better support, she also works as a garment worker, while her husband is a goldsmith. The current business earns her family the daily income of about US$12 but she is able to save US$6 each day. 

Chanthy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. 

She is going to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her paddy field.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 40, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Prek district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last eight years, Mom has been growing corn and working as a paid worker. She can earn about 80,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Mom is just with VisionFund for this cycle, and now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy household appliances, such as a clock and kitchen supplies. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy household appliances.

loans.name: Liliana Paola

texts.es:
En busca de una entrada de dinero Liliana junto con su madre inicio de manera ambulante un restaurante el cual gracias al excelente sabor de sus comidas tuvo gran éxito y le permitió expandirse y montar un restaurante con la cual han mejorado considerablemente las condiciones de vida de su familia e incluso se han dado la oportunidad de comenzar a construir una casa propia. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas las cuales podemos ver en la foto pues quieren formalizar su negocio y convertirse en el restaurante típico del barrio.
texts.en:
Seeking income, Liliana together with her mother began selling food as street vendors.  Thanks to the excellence of their food she had great success, allowing her to expand the business and start a restaurant, with which she has greatly improved the living conditions of her family and even given them the chance to begin building their own house.

She is asking for a loan to buy the tables and chairs we see in the photo since she wants to formalize her business and become a traditional neighborhood restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and kitchen appliances for her restaurant

loans.name: Bora's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Bora is 40 years old and has two children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 22 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

Bora’s group consists of two members and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Soun Nang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Soun Nang, 32, has four children in total, three are in school while another one is too young for school. Nang and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for 14 years to make a living. 

Soun Nang has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, Soun Nang wants to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Jeng's Group

texts.en:
Jeng, 49, lives with three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. Two of her three children are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for almost 21 years. 

Jeng has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and send and keep her children in school. She can earn about 85,000 KHR per day from her current business. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice paddy.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 61, is from a rural village located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with five children. She and her husband earn a living through planting cassava and farming rice. They have been in this business for 25 years. The current business earns her family about 38,000 KHR per day.

This is Khoern’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Khoern is a second time borrower with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Khoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sabai's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Sabai is aged 36 years and married with five children, two of whom are still too small for school while the other three are in school. For several years, the main source of the family’s income is from rice farming. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sabai’s group consists of five members and Sabai is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sabai, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min, aged 52, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district. She has six children. She is a widowed mother. To support her family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava and also working as a garment worker. She has been in this business for 34 years. 

Min is has been with VisionFund for four cycles and now she is asking for another loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Baba Nilakanthaeswara Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, eleven women from a village of Khurda district stepped out and decided to build a secured future for their families. They formed a group named “Baba Nilakanthaeswara Self-Help Group” (named after Lord Shiva, who they believe will protect them). The members of Baba Nilakanthaeswara Self-Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. 

One of them is Mrs. Manjulata, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Manjulata. Manjulata is 26 years old and is staying with her husband and her child. Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. 

She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. She took some land for lease and started vegetable cultivation on a small scale. She started with a limited supply of vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes and grew to sell more than seven varieties such as brinjal (eggplant), cucumbers, beans, carrots, and radishes. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village, as she sells fresh and high-quality vegetables. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Now she has a new idea of doing sugarcane cultivation, for which she has requested a loan to utilize for the resources necessary to grow sugarcane. A portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to pay for resources such as sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides for her sugarcane plantation.

loans.name: Vanroen

texts.en:
Aged 25 years old, Varoen is a married mother of two little children living in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income and her husband supplements the income by working as a paid worker. Vanroen has been in this business for eight years.

Vanroen is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is applying for a loan to pay for buying seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for buying seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Chan is 34 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She has been selling vegetables to earn additional income for her family. Her husband is a taxi driver. Having been in this business for almost 16 years, she currently can earn about 7,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the microloan for Chan’s group of four and she is the first cycled client. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. She hopes to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 35 years, Sokheang is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of two children. She earns a living through growing rice and working as a garment worker, which she has been doing for 17 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 32,000 per day from the current business, and are able to save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Sokheang with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, La is aged 40 years and married with three children. For more than 22 years, she and her husband have been growing rice. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for La with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yoer's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Yoer is 56 years old and married. She has three dependent children. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. She has been in this business for almost 40 years. 

Yoer is just with VisionFund for this cycle, and now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice so as to increase her family’s income to better her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plants

loans.name: Margaritas De Xejuyu Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank or “Margaritas de Xejuyú,” meaning ”The Daisies down the Mountain,” is composed of seven enthusiastic ladies who live in San Lucas Tolimán on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlán in the western highlands of Guatemala. The women have joined together to expand their small businesses, improve their lives, help their families prosper and eliminate poverty. This loan cycle is the first time that they are requesting loans from Kiva and only the second time from Friendship Bridge.

Sonia is a 39-year-old member of the Trust Bank and has four children. She has had three years of formal education, and because of her leadership skills and her great desire to excel, Sonia has been elected president of the group. She has a convenience store and is requesting a loan to add inventory to her store. Sonia needs to purchase rice, beans, oil, salt, noodles, sugar and drinks in order to meet the demand of her customers.

It is essential that the women learn how to manage their loans, so the Microcredit Plus program of Friendship Bridge is especially useful for them. A loan officer attends their monthly meetings and shares relevant information with the ladies on subjects like accounting, budgeting, customer service, indebtedness, marketing and pricing. The ladies also benefit from increased knowledge about health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as the use of medicinal plants. Attending their meetings, one notices more smiles and increased self esteem.

Sonia and her friends in the “Margaritas de Xejuyú” Trust Bank extend their heartfelt gratitude to Kiva investors. They feel fortunate to be together, to work toward the common goals of empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their families and community. Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort!

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, salt, noodles, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, who used a previous loan to buy used clothes to sell, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children between ages 11 and 18. Two of the children attend school. She also has a retail shop which is supplemented by produce sales. She desires to grow her business, although competition and limited capital frustrate her efforts.

She will use the money to buy more sugar, salt and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and general merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine, and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy lives in a rural village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old, and married with one baby daughter. To support her family, she has been growing rice and working as a paid construction worker for 10 years. 

Chanthy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eryy

texts.en:
Eryy, 57, lives in a rural village in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She is married and has five children. For the last 37 years, Eryy has been growing rice. She can earn about 36,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Eryy has been with VisionFund for three cycles, and now she is applying for a loan to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Mom is aged 35 and living in a rural village in the Kom Rieng district of Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has three dependent children who are still in school.

To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and grow corn as main sources of her family’s income, and they have been in this business for 8 years.

Mom is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, 36, lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has six children.

For the last 8 years, Hen has been growing cassava and rice. To better support the family, she also works as a paid worker. She can earn about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Hen has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles and now she is applying for a loan to pay for buying fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase posts and mesh to put up a fence, and to purchase sheet metal and headers to change the roof over the patio.
